Any fruit fly or wasp would have already fled with flapping wings and galloping little legs at the mere scent of the artificial aroma.

I've encountered other Dior fragrances that I wouldn't subject myself to for any amount of money or good words, but that definitely doesn't mean I think they're bad. They just don't suit my taste at all. However, I never expected there would be a scent that would make me shudder in horror. There are now countless regulations that prohibit super delicious-smelling ingredients, which are bitterly missed by legions of perfume lovers, but who in the name of three devils is protecting us from substances that make every fly drop dead from the wall?! I'm going to start a petition now; surely Angie needs to bang on the table and give the Europeans a good kick in the pants.

So - I'm off... Scrubbing off the poison, averting a coma, and submitting the petition. (I'll post the link later if I make it through tomorrow)

I've wanted this fragrance for so long, and I really hope it will be mine soon.

The bottle is a dream. I love these Addict bottles. They are simple, elegant, and showcase clear lines. They represent exactly what the fragrance conveys: There are no compromises here. We are talking about Dior!

While the "normal" Addict is a very intense, somewhat heavier evening scent, Addict Shine comes with a refreshing, fruity-delicious, and carefree note that invigorates its wearer and simply brings her to life.
It is definitely a fragrance that I did not expect from Dior.

Towards the "end," Addict Shine also remains delicious, but it becomes softer, more feminine, and overall still uncomplicated and unobtrusive. In my opinion, the predecessor fragrances also have very clear positive aspects, but they can never quite match Shine (for me). A fragrance that leaves you wanting more. It works anytime, fits any occasion, and is still simply Dior.

I envision the woman wearing this fragrance running through wide, tall flower meadows, dressed in a light, loosely fitting dress. In the distance, fruit trees stand, gently swaying in the wind ...

I love it.

review_title: Hmm, I don't really find it intoxicating
review_content: Not exactly complex and confusing, but rather straightforwardly raspberry-like, so it fits perfectly on a sunny spring day.

review_title: Herbs in the Ruins without Arches
review_content:
First, I read FranFan's comment and stumbled upon the explanation of the origin of the name "Arc" L'Arc. Karnak and arches? I ran to our exhibition poster: "Prussia on the Nile," where the ruins of Karnak are depicted in the 19th century and drawn in the state they were in when someone from a German expedition meticulously sketched them there. The then-modern cameras could not withstand the climate on the Nile. Drawings can often depict reality more authentically than photos, as is the case here.
These ruins look more like a further developed and very refined construction of Stonehenge. There are no arches, only columns with cross stones placed on them, artistically designed and smoothly finished, beautiful columns. Everything is covered with engraved hieroglyphs and people depicted in profile in the style of that time. Everything is in decay; tilted and broken columns, fallen stone blocks. And in the midst of it, to show the size relations, a small group of people is sketched, half sitting and leaning against the huge fallen stone blocks. No arches, nowhere.
So much for "Karnak" in the 19th century, now to "Aventure":
I have never smelled a scent like this before. At first, I smell a mixture of mandarin and sandalwood, strange and not unpleasant. Then a fruity acidity like that of unripe fruit mixes in. This acidity transforms into a citrusy one after about 20 minutes. I actually expected a foul-smelling jasmine. But I smell nothing of the sort, no jasmine at all. Or one that I do not know. "Aventure" has a peculiar scent. Something herbal is present, tarragon, possibly coriander leaves, maybe both could be it.
The L'Arc fragrances are not complicated; this one also has a short development for me and then stands: slightly fruity-woody and citrusy, bitter, somewhat herbal, without sweetness, without resinous notes. Musk or vanilla do not come through for me. It could be one of the herbal scents.
Overall, a subtle fragrance that, despite its strange scent mixture, does not trigger a washing impulse for me. The longevity is okay.
"Aventure" is a wearable spring and summer scent for those who like such sour herbal fragrances without sweetness, in my opinion. Men could also at least test this scent.

The opening is bright and fruity with a passion fruit accord. This quickly dissipates and turns into a smoky incense that is a bit mysterious and very satisfying to the nose. The dry down seems to be a slight oud with a silk scent. It is one of the smoothest oud dry downs I have ever smelled. The scent projects loud for an hour or two and lasts as a smooth silky oud scent for 6-7 hours.
As others have mentioned the DNA is similar to Oud Maracuja but there are difference. Oud maracuja is brighter and fruitier while Velvet Passion Oud is the smoky mysterious cousin. If you want to make a statement and want an in your face fragrance go with Oud Maracuja by Maison Crivelli. If you want a more subdued, mysterious fragrance go with Velvet Passion Oud by Dolce & Gabana.
I also view Velvet Passion Oud as better for cooler temperatures, where as Oud Maracuja thrives in hot temperatures.
This is a nice, light gourmand scent: the toffee makes this for me. This is appropriate for work or anywhere. It's inexpensive, but it smells great. The only negative is moderate sillage.

review_title: Oud? More floral and fruity than anything else
review_content:
Musk wa oud, so Musk and Oud has not listed any Musk, which surprised me quite a bit, because I can clearly smell Musk.

The opening is very Musk-heavy, fruity, sweet, and at the same time fresh.
The fruity notes are not particularly authentic.
Everything feels a bit too synthetic and carelessly made.
I can't even say which fruit I really perceive; it could be
mandarin or orange, along with lavender, which also doesn't really come across as high quality.

In the dry down, the floral notes take over, of which I perceive freesia the most.
I must say the dry down is more bearable and somewhat more feminine than the opening, which I would describe as unisex.
Even the dry down is still unisex, but it leans quite feminine.
Even though the scent develops more pleasantly, it never really feels high quality.
I no longer perceive "Musk" as strongly; the fruity notes also recede a bit into the background and accompany the floral notes until the end.
No trace of Oud at all.

Longevity on my skin is 4-5 hours.
Of course, this can vary from skin to skin.
Sillage is rather weak to moderate.
In the first hour, it's at most moderate; afterwards, it’s more of a skin scent on me.

Unisex? Just barely, especially due to the floral notes in the dry down being a bit too feminine for my taste (W70%/30%M).

My conclusion: too synthetic, no character, feels very cheap, I would not recommend it.
Khadlaj can definitely do better.

Time, you director of our lives.
Who or what are you? -
A thought, a feeling?
A sequence of events,
a course, a flow? - Rush?
The senses do not know you,
they exist only in the now.

For them, it is always now.
Also for our consciousness -
not for thinking, which needs time
for the processes of its thought chains.
But consciousness, that is conscious being,
always takes place in the present,
in the constant now.
NOWNOWNOW!

Now, as I write,
now, as I inhale your essence,
you treasure of past times.
Time is so often measured,
and you, MG, have gifted yourself in countless nows,
no, given,
you are still here!

You grant me a bath of sensations
in the green stream of light.
All sorts of blossoms float within you,
variously fine, iris-powdery, rose-noble,
heart-bewitching and soul-uplifting.
And iridescent soap bubbles float
through your floral silk.

Your green river light
reaches to the bottom,
illuminating its own bed
of soft musk moss
and spicy sweetgrass-cinnamon balm.

Somehow you seem to have always
been there,
as an idea in a timeless world.
Which, when the timelessness was ripe
and opened a time slot,
condensed into a drop,
and became an inspiration
for an open mind.

Soap in a persistent mist
Like a fine web
It weaves through the green

As bright as fresh grass
As soft as delicate moss
As spicy as young herbs

It lies between the flowers
Takes away their nectar sweetness
Lets the buds dance

They hum in the same rhythm
Smile with bitter grace
Breathe green life

Quiet being in silky wood
Earth crumbs and gentle resin
Everything united in the mild green flow

review_title: The Dream Of An Endless Summer
review_content:
If you're wondering what an old bad boy like me is doing with a buddy scent, read on. First, Hollister is a brand I've known for over a decade. To be exact, I fell in love with the fragrance I breathed in stores about ten years ago, so much so that I bought it. And I'm talking about SoCal COLOGNE. Since then, I have bought no other perfumes of the same brand, apart from it, which I still own today and I adore. Until the other day, when I made up my mind and tested the three fragrances of the Hollister's Festival collection for him. I only tried Festival Vibes for Him and Festival Nite for Him as Party had recently arrived in the store, and they didn't have the tester. Having a 50% discount available, I ventured into a bulk purchase and then blindly took all three but Party. And since I couldn't resist, I opened it first, and now I want to describe it to you. The official website depicts it as fresh, aquatic, aromatic, marine, and young. I find it important to say that the three perfumes are not flankers of each other, and each perfume has a different aroma from the others.

Ouch, Festival Party takes off with a blast of alcohol, very strong and in the face. Be aware and wait a moment before smelling it. Then, luckily, a pleasant citrus note of lemon mixed with salty pepper replaces the alcoholic edge, with a clear blue lavender playing in the background. The first impression is an interesting summer cologne with fresh and aquatic undertones. Because of the very gorgeous, eye-catching light red box and featuring the mango element, I was expecting something exotic, overly sweet, and fruity. Instead, this scent opens up fresh and peppery, with a hint of nuanced mango that's nowhere near as sweet as I feared. Think unripe mango-flavoured water where the feeling is there but not the sweetness. So far, so good. Well, something familiar about that smell reminds me of another scent. I bet it is the mango, which has been used the same way in another fragrance. In the initial stage, the pepper and lemon mix stands out.

The scent turns mossy, aquatic, and still slightly fruity as time goes by. The heart releases whiffs of dewy flowers, which I guess are the waterlily blossoms, with a marine-like mossiness akin to algae and calone without the melon nuance. Of course, the green mango lingers around, not prominent but present. The middle stage merges sea and fruit.

Finally, the cologne dries to the earthy base of clean patchouli, enhanced by the presence of amber and a sweetish wood like guaiac. This final aroma stays long and lingers on the skin. As I said above, the perfume reminds me of another fragrance, and I think I'm not mistaken if I say that the fruity part in which the mango participates is very similar to the sensations released by Escape for Men EAU DE TOILETTE, the reformulated version in my possession. Same vibe, without the riot of aromatic herbs.

Festival Party dresses well in the scorching heat of outdoor summer afternoons and evenings. Most likely, the formula also includes a portion of Iso E Super because I still feel puffs of fragrance even when it's not as strong on my skin anymore. It has good duration, certainly more than half a day, and at the beginning, it also has a good projection. Promoted unexpectedly!

I base the review on a 50ml bottle I have owned since August 2022.

-Elysium

review_title: Clean yet powerful yet tonka beast mode
review_content:
It goes for that creamy, soft-clean vibe, but on me it feels a bit heavy. Tonka bean totally steals the show — warm, sweet, with a hint of almond — so you really have to love tonka to enjoy this one.
It opens with a powdery, almost milky feel, then shifts into a sweet amber-vanilla base. I also catch some slightly indolic florals in there, which throw me off a bit — like, hmm? It’s missing some air, some contrast… it just stays kind of dense and flat.
Honestly, it reminds me of a Blanche Bête + lilac and wisteria added in. Chic in theory, but way too rich and overdone for my taste.

I love, love, love this gorgeous heady fougere perfume. I don't like fougere in general, but this one just blew me away. I am hit with the most gorgeous pine and rosemary, followed by the heady florals and the bitter woodiness at the base. Out of all the HJ men's one, this is the top of the chart.

Anyone expecting the well-known Zadig & Voltaire DNA will be disappointed or maybe not... Cherry-floral with a slightly peppery summer scent, not too heavy, which is not the case for any of the candidates from the house. The opening is somewhat synthetic, a peppery, bright red cherry that drifts into a creamy note over time. Almost like a lovely cherry body lotion! I personally do not perceive either chestnut or violet, which is a plus for me with this perfume. In the drydown, sandalwood. The benzoin helps with better absorption and unfolding of the perfume on the skin. Those who want to experience the cherry-pepper kick again and again will unfortunately have to reapply throughout the day, but that is the case with all candidates from Zadic. The only exception: Just Rock Pour Elle.

(Yes I was singing the song when I typed in the title haha)

NR for Her
She is dark and sexy. A little mysterious and a bit dirty. Once you get a whiff of her she's stuck in your head and can't get her out. You want to be near her, touch her, please her, be totally consumed by her. She sets off an aura of self confidence and class. When NR for Her is present all eyes are on her.

Longevity 6-8 hours on skin
Sillage is moderate, but I have noticed people want to get as close to you as possible when wearing this.

I was prompted to write a review of 'For Her' after smelling 'For Women' (white bottle) a few days ago.
This is the one (FH) with good sillage and elusive musks, the EDP is peachier with definite stickability.
The EDT is the equivalent of a Toyota Corolla, ubiquitous, rust free, user friendly with good economy. It lacks imagination but statistics show it benefits from repeat purchasers, and you can soup it up with the 'In colour' or 'Musc Intense' add-ons that men love, like a leather bound steering wheel or Recaro seats. That men love this is not in question, my husband loves the sillage hours after I have put it on.
Let's face it, it's a must have, it's your favourite pair of jeans or possibly your favourite pair of knickers; you, but better, with Narciso at the leather bound steering wheel, cruising the Napa valley, tasting astringent wines that mellow with age, For Her in a Toyota Corolla.

I first encountered Narciso Rodriquez For Her while visiting a girlfriend in Chicago. Trailing this perfume, she walked by me after we'd gotten dressed for an evening out. The scent riveted my attention. I asked what it was, wrote down the name, came home and promptly bought it. Later I learned it's a favorite of Michelle Obama, which helps explain why a love affair's been underway for so long at the White House. Last night hubby sniffed it for the first time in a while. It must have riveted his attention, too, because he informed me that instead of wasting time studying and buying different perfumes, I could just wear this. It was better than everything I had.

He's biased, being male. Narciso Rodriquez is a blatantly sexy fragrance. Its rich indolic top notes combine with the luxuriously musky heart to create a classy come-hither perfume. Nice to have it in our arsenals because there are times when all a female of our species really wants to say is, "Hey, you handsome rascal over there. Stop gawking, come here, and unzip me."

~ I have wanted to get my nose on this popular designer 'fume for a long time but until just recently thanks to a perfumista friend couldn't, thank-you! My primary interest was as I had read that this might be wearable and venture into the unisex realm? Trust me other than "maybe" the final end with a hint of woody notes, no! This is "extremely sexy and for her" sorry for the lack of tact but there is no other word! I knew from the initial sample spray it was an intoxicating opening of musk and orange blossom. Shortly later I could almost taste the amber and vanilla sweet elixir! This would make me be so bold as to ask a strange woman respectfully what she was wearing and give her an enthusiastic compliment. It held on tight to my masculine skin on the wrist so I assume it is a close skin scent which can be both very discreet and also perfect for an enchanting night with a significant. If it's any indication of the effect on a woman's neck I could not keep my nose from dipping to my wrist for most of the day, very sensual and magnetic! I now see why it is consistently listed with Dior Poison, TFBO and Coco Noir etc. when a "certain" forum topic comes up looking for bottle suggestions....it deserves it!
Scent - 4/5

Kind Regards, Plat ~

This review is meant to be a warning from someone who dislikes this fragrance. Please read on if you think about gifting or blind-buying this.

I know that Narciso Rodriguez For Her is hugely popular since it first came out, and over the years I have smelled it on some other women on whom it developes to a sexy, sensual musk scent that just edges on dirty but never fully goes there.
On me, it doesn‘t work at all. Neither this EDT, nor the EDP, nor most of the fragrances that are considered similar. I have tried lots of these perfumes, Velvet Haze, Cleopatra, Romantina... Almost all turn sour and sharp on me. The combination of the specific musks in the For Her line with patchouli just doesn‘t work on every skin. And the original For Her EDT is the worst of them all, it can smell skanky and almost urinuos at time and also has that strong, floral opening that is like a punch to the nose for me.
I‘m no fragrance wimp, I like some strong scents and don’t hate many, but when I gave For Her EDT another chance in 2018 because I got a new sample and sprayed it not on me, but on my husband's arm, I had to leave the room because I found it overwhelming. Last week I sampled it again on a blotter because I had it in a travelling fragrance box, and nope, still absolutely not for me.

So, this is not a barely-there soft office friendly skin musk, as some suggest. Anosmia to musk notes is common and I imagine that that‘s the reason while some perceive this as sexy or dirty and others as light white musk.
It‘s also totally different from the Narciso range in the cube shaped bottles. Those all have a different kind of musk note. I think it‘s softer and cleaner and I love it. So if you like something from one Narciso Rodriguez line, it‘s not impossible that you hate the other line. But if you love any of the scents regarded as similar and don't know this yet, it's a classic that's worth a try. I guess.
Just please don‘t overspray this one!

Not being a big fan of heavy musk perfumes, I was never really the target for Narciso Rodriguez FOR HER, whether the eau de parfum or the eau de toilette. Both are extremely heavy on the musk. The last time I tried the pink version (eau de parfum), I was overwhelmed by the musk and had to go take a bath before I had the chance to write a review. This evening, with a hot...

review_title: Do you fancy osmanthus by any chance?
review_content: I'm just asking because this beauty right here taught me that I do very much fancy osmanthus. In fact, I'm painfully in love with it, and so far I like this iteration of the note the most. The entire perfume - starting with the design of the bottle, the simple name, and how it sits on my skin, all of that - makes me want to swoon over it and urge everyone to try it at least...

This is a comfy fragrance, my impression upon smelling it for the first time was that it felt familiar, like a favorite sweater, soft and laundered countless times... Surely you have grabbed such a garment, brought it up to your face and smelled the familiar traces of your life there, even though the sweater is clean.

For Her is a bit like that: It smells warm, soft, comfortable, familiar, and while it is a light scent, it stays with you easily throughout the day.
Not an grand entrance maker or a sillage monster, this one won't get noticed unless someone comes close, which is exactly how I tend to prefer my scents to behave.

The first 5-7 minutes on my skin are projecting sharper musky-osmanthus combination, which I personally like a lot. What follows is the floral orange blossom, osmanthus heart, although I personally detect some jasmine thrown in for good measure. The florals dominate for about an hour giving way to the leftover osmanthus and amber with warm vanilla, which is basically what sells it to me. It is a seriously seductive perfume which has no close competition composition-wise. Quite divine, this one!

One of my favorite fragrances. I discovered it thanks to a decant and since then everything was love.

I find it extremely elegant, feminine, timeless, ageless. A scent that makes you feel well dressed and present without being overwhelming.

The notes that stand out the most in me are the orange blossom with the musk and a slight vanilla. For me, the EDT beats the EDP a thousand times.

The only time I don't use it is during summer with very high temperatures but for the rest of the year it works for me at all times and moments of the day. Beautiful.

Powdery florals, not in an old lady way but definitely powdery, with an undercurrent of green, spicy patchouli throughout. I would call this a "lighter" floral patchouli scent, a little sexy but more flirty and feminine. An approachable patchouli, perhaps. It's not for me. I dislike powdery florals, with very few exceptions. But objectively, I can see why this has lasted on the perfume scene as long as it has. It has the DNA of a classic.

#1: vintage make-up
#2: soft rose petals
#3: musk

Do I like this scent? No
Do I want to smell like it? No
Another sample/travel size worthy? No
Do I need a full bottle? No

The aunt who loves perfume, but all the scents on her vanity are the same. And what I mean by that is she plays it safe and sticks to the uber-feminine notes and does not budge. I really don't like this scent as its mass-appealing in a way that's boring. Any other perfume at a Macy's would smell like this.

Holy shit. This fragrance makes me do things. Easily one of the best women's fragrance OAT. I don't know where to start. This legit smells like a tall, boss woman, telling you to do things, even against your will, but you still do them. Smells like you're about to get dominated. I know I sound crazy saying this. But this isn't an ordinary ladies fragrance. It's SOMETHING. One of my faves on older women.

Right off the bat I can see where the comparisons to Egyptian Musk are being made. This feels like the best Egyptian Musk plus orange blossom and osmanthus. The musk here is a little waxy and a whole lot human. The whole fragrance feels very natural to me, even the florals smell like I would expect an actual flower to smell like and I usually struggle with fragrance...

review_title: Sharp and Delicate. Sexy and Poised.
review_content:
I really like this perfume, but I can easily see why it could also be polarizing for some people. It is sexy, sharp, and poised, but it can be delicate as well. It’s musk and powder and beautifully dries down to a white floral, but a citrusness is also very present.

The reason I can see people not being into it is the musk. It is musky, very musky, it is animalic, even though there is a citrusness to it and a light floral, that are things we pair with cleanness, it has an underlying skankiness to it. I love it, but I don't think it's a safe blind buy.

I like this. I really do. It has enough uniqueness to be interesting - if that is possible. The fine mix of the four notes is very delicate and delightful. It suits a white shirt as well as a sexy dress. To me there is no sweetness, just flowers and a sharpness that suits the scent so well. It lasts forever.
The bottle, in its simplicity, is beautiful. Ladylike and stylish on the shelf. Timeless like the perfume.
Good job
154/365

review_title: Smells dirty and like body odor
review_content: I do not get the rave reviews. Maybe its the patchouli and Osmanthus combination. IT smells like the bristles of a dusty broom or the coconut husk we use for polishing floors in the Phils. On my skin it morphed into BO and stinky scalp. Good thing i only got a 10 ml decant for trial. Will finish this off or just give away.
EDT: Long lasting for an EDT a more creamy soft version of EDP with a more soft barely there musk. unfortunately it will not be added to my collection, but people seem to love it at Sephora

"Ah, Gerlinde, come in! I didn't expect you at all." "Hello Helga! Yes, it's sort of an emergency." "Oh dear, what's going on?" "Well, Horst-Holger and I have been - um... together for a while now. But something terrible happened yesterday at Aldi!" "Come on, just tell me, what happened?" "We get to the checkout, and there's this blonde poison, with a diamond stud in her nose,...

review_title: Balanced Women's Fragrance with Style and Elegance
review_content:
Narciso Rodriguez For Her is a fragrance that has accompanied me for what feels like an eternity. It is my mother's favorite scent, and because of that, I have smelled this fragrance countless times and even gifted it. Once, I mistakenly bought the pink EDP, thinking it was the same scent, just stronger. A beginner's mistake from some time ago. Today, of course, I know that Intense, EDP, and their counterparts often differ from the EDT. This is also the case here. The EDT is the big star of this brand. The entire series of this fragrance, with all its flankers, is very popular in the fragrance community. And rightly so. The brand itself is quite unknown, but with this fragrance, Narciso Rodriguez has hit the jackpot. I own the men's version, For Him, which harmonizes with this scent and goes in a similar direction. Both are designed by the living legend Francis Kurkdjian, here in collaboration with Christine Nagel, who is also no stranger.

The bottle is fitting for the fragrance: simple, elegant, and very stylish. A heavy, understated bottle that feels good in the hand.
Upon freshly spraying it, it immediately starts off very elegantly and impresses with a confident elegance. It begins with a lot of power, bursting with full floral intensity. Orange blossom and osmanthus are very present from the start. Soon, a lovely musk note joins in. For women's fragrances, this dosage is rather unusual, but it beautifully sets this scent apart and gives it an interesting individuality. It also pairs wonderfully with the floral notes. A touch of bergamot adds a slight freshness and lightens it up. A bit of sensual amber complements it. This fragrance is wonderfully sensual, yet not too provocative. Sexy in a stylish way. Towards the end, a light sweetness emerges, likely from vanilla. However, this sweetness is rather subtle in the background. What stands out throughout the entire duration is a lovely floral note with plenty of musk on a slightly powdery base. Extremely well done. It is very balanced and versatile.

The performance is quite good, especially in the first few hours. However, after 5 hours, it becomes quite weak. Unfortunately. It remains somewhat lasting, but more in a light version. Nevertheless, it has a convincing performance, as it radiates well for many hours.
This fragrance is also versatile due to its elegant balance. It fits especially well with a more sophisticated outfit. Wonderful to wear for the evening, in leisure time, or even in everyday work. It will definitely appeal to the majority. Additionally, it is a year-round fragrance, except in very hot temperatures. A clear recommendation for purchase for women and as a gift idea for men. It may not be cheap, but it remains within a reasonable range.

I really wanted to like it, the much-praised one, the "crowd-pleaser" that gives the wearer a cool sex appeal, turns men's heads, and fits every occasion and season with loud praises. It is certainly not a bad perfume (so many fans can't be wrong) and the H/S is excellent, but: I cannot stand it on myself. Too intrusive and somehow "lilac" / soapy, it remains flat and penetrating for me. No, unfortunately, we will not be friends.

Well, it has come over me, I must say a few words about this "almost classic," as it has now become one of my favorites. Thanks to Parfumo, for about 5 years now, I have had the pleasure of getting to know this beautiful, endlessly fascinating fragrance. Every time it ran out, I had to repurchase it. Nothing could compare to this fresh-floral, black musk dream. Sure, you...

This fragrance leaves me a bit uncertain. On one hand, I find it very special and attractive, on the other hand, I feel that it might be just a tad too much for me or that I would eventually tire of it. Referring to the title, I would initially be fascinated by the woman if I saw her for the first time and even for some time afterward, before I would realize that she might be too much for me, too much woman. But that doesn't have to be the case; it's just a feeling :)
After reading that Kurkdjian developed this fragrance, I thought it fits. I find many of his scents to be very pleasant, very soft, enveloping, and dense, although never too heavy and of very high quality. However, over time, they usually become too much for me, perhaps because they are too perfect.

Fragrance development:
The opening is unusual, surprising, and beautiful. I perceive a slightly dry red wine note mixed with a gummy-sweet cherry note. This combination is quite fascinating. After a few minutes, it transforms into an elegant lipstick note with a slightly dirty-dry undertone. For the first time, I had the association of a mature (not in age), elegant, and seductive woman who is very aware of her effect. This lipstick impression lingered for a long time before a somewhat indefinable floral note pushed more to the forefront. Throughout the truly long development, this fragrance remains so floral-powdery, with vetiver and patchouli providing a very slightly herbaceous-earthy touch. I assume that the osmanthus oil, which is said to have a very intensely sweet and uplifting scent, contributes to this unusual, slightly cherry-floral impression.

Longevity and sillage:
The longevity was excellent at over 12 hours. After a night, I could still perceive it well on my wrist. The sillage was distinctly noticeable for over 12 hours, although it was never too dominant. This long and strong longevity was also a problem I had with the fragrance. It was on the verge of being overpowering for me.

Bottle:
I really like the shape and color; it symbolizes the modern, feminine elegance of the fragrance well.

Conclusion:
A fascinatingly elegant feminine fragrance, mysterious, seductive, lovely, floral, powdery, cherry-like. A great mix of softness and strength! For me, it's on the edge of being too much. Perfect for occasional use, especially for going out and seducing :)

review_title: The Many Faces of Narciso Rodriguez
review_content:
Do you know that feeling when curiosity grabs you, and you can't rest until you've unraveled a secret? Or when ambition takes hold, and you practice until you've not only mastered something but brought it to perfection?

Not knowing or being unable to do something bothers me. Especially when it comes to my hobby. About a year ago, I noticed that I had a kind of "scent blindness" to musk fragrances. To be precise, I was testing Narciso Rodriguez's "For Her" and smelled - nothing. Or almost nothing. I recorded this irritating experience in my comment on the EdP. And learned that you can train your nose or your brain. You can guess what comes next ;-)

I started with a bottle of the EdP and then tested all the flankers that came my way. And there are quite a few, as Mr. Rodriguez has made it his mission to capture musk in all its facets and bottle it. I haven't gone through all the variations yet, but I want to give you a little overview - maybe it will help some of you with your selection.

“For Her” EdP: Musk as a floral-warm, rounded, rich scent. Sensual but not overtly animalistic. In the course, it is rather calm. Very nice, but more cuddly than seductive.

“For Her” EdT: in the top note significantly more floral, "happier," and more effervescent than the EdP. Towards the base, a clear shift towards musk and vetiver, making it feel more restless and exciting. Overall more enticing, sexier, and younger than the EdP. Unfortunately, I can't reconcile myself with the vetiver note.

“For Her in Color”: strong similarity to the “For Her” EdP, especially in the base. Amber & musk are emphasized, making it feel a bit more animalistic.

“Musc Collection for Her”: even more musk and amber. The other notes are only barely perceptible to me; at most minimally floral, and on my skin also minimally sweet (but really only minimally). It clearly stands out from sweet-fruity mainstream fragrances; definitely unmistakable. Even more animalistic than “In Color” - for me, it's already too much.

“For Her Delicate” EdT: noticeably fruitier and a bit sweeter than the original, especially in the top and heart notes. Perhaps an approach to the currently preferred fragrance direction in the mainstream. Yet it is precisely the uniqueness that makes the NR fragrances so special and desirable. The base, however, approaches the EdT again; however, the vetiver is not as present, or is kept in check by the lingering fruity aromas.

“Essence”: the clean musk. Oh, is it CLEAN! It smells just like I imagined the scent of “Pure White Linen” would smell. Freshly washed, impeccably clean, pore-deep pure white laundry, dried in the fresh air of a spring day, amidst a meadow with small, colorful flowers. The opening is overwhelming. One could also say, penetrating. Clean. And even cleaner. After 1-2 hours, it becomes typically soft-creamy for NR, but it remains one of the cleanest clean scents I have ever smelled.

“Essence Eau de Musc”: more like clean, freshly lotioned skin than clean laundry. At the very beginning, it also has a fresh laundry note, but more citrusy than its predecessor. And it transforms in the next few minutes into a well-groomed, delicately fresh skin scent. Especially lovely in summer.

I intentionally wrote nothing about the sillage, as it is perceived VERY differently from person to person, especially with musk fragrances.
Some can't perceive these scents at all or only very faintly. Most perceive them fairly well, like other perfumes. When I apply 3-4 sprays of “For Her” EdP in the morning, most have to come quite close in the afternoon to smell anything. However, a colleague can still smell me in the hallway even then. Not that he minds - he thinks the scent is great (verbatim: “Incredible! IN-CREDIBLE!!”). Generally, “For Her” seems to be quite well received by men, but not in an overtly erotic way like, for example, “Hypnotic Poison,” but rather in a nicely groomed, feminine way.

If I have piqued your interest now: have fun testing! There’s something for everyone at NR :)

review_title: Stop and let it sink in until the darkest spot in your soul
review_content:
"The black is like a cooling of the relative to the zero point.
In this ambivalent interpretation of calm and activity lies for me the principle of black, like a great breath." - Reiner Ruthenbeck

Yes, I also have a great breath. However, it is not calm and certainly not regular when I smell For Her EdT. Yes, even when I think of it, it boils inside me.

I have recently become aware of it. It fascinated me from the very beginning. Yesterday I discovered it on my niece and was delighted to find that it also works well on my skin, even if only for a short time. But there is no tension at all. I sprayed it on my scarf and since I once again couldn't sleep much, I smelled it for half the night and let myself be intoxicated by it.

The bottle feels cool against my neck with its appearance. A simple, small block, dyed black on the inside, with the name of the perfume written in small pink letters.

It is only cool in its appearance. Narciso R. EdT is a very powdery, skin-close, and brilliant scent for the most beautiful moments in our lives. It has nothing evil about it, yet it has everything under control when one wants to approach it. It is powerful in its revelation and lets everyone know who is in charge here. To play around and wrap someone up is just as good for it as for a femme fatale. However, it seduces not with its appearance, but with its character. Gracefully and skillfully, it wraps many around its finger. In my circle of friends, the scent has a pretty high standard. Yes, it makes quite a few of us quite giddy. Let's take a little carousel ride, dear community, and then enjoy a really good vanilla ice cream ;0)

I have to think a little bit about soft sex first when I hold the scent close to my nose and really inhale it deeply. A little flirt, a tension between the two poles, hot glances... what started in pouring rain and then continued next to the fireplace. Sensual, bubbling little kisses fly onto my skin and let everything melt so beautifully into me. It literally merges with one... As DaveGahan101 wrote before me - I could lie down in this scent and linger in it for hours, it excites and ignites me so much!

The soft sex jumps off after the bergamot retreats to the background with the fine orange. The two form an extremely good connection with each other and do not play off against one another. They remain on the same line. They are straightforward, like the bottle of the perfume itself. Osmanthus is very aquatic for me here and keeps the scent somewhat grounded so as not to sink into the depths right away. All in all, a very clean, feminine scent that has very clear structures. No corners and edges - but hey! - also round and full, and in this case very, very powdery can be extremely interesting... I have to (and don’t know why) think of a somewhat plump woman when I let my imagination play. Full femininity, wrapped in beautiful, noble black clothing - round eyes and quite a respectable chest. The laughter always spread wide across her face and an aura that doesn't let go of you...

When the creaminess joins in, then it is perfect for me. Musk has spread its path wide in the perfume. It is the heart of the perfume. It gives it the depth it needs. But it never lets itself fall. The freshness has departed. Nothing is aquatic anymore. It is now powdery-creamy and has this unforgettable and very own floral touch. Softness takes the stage. So soft that the previous kisses return, but no longer melt into me, rather glide over my body like warm wax. Creamy, flowing, and so cuddly... It remains like this until the end. The passionate blood of my imagination pulses. The breath begins to hitch. The carousel spins faster and faster... The lights around me form a line - a spectacle for my eyes - a feast for my senses. I almost lose my grip within myself and seem to fall - even if it is only in a dream... And then this vanilla - noble, soft, and so arousing. Vetiver holds back in the background, supporting the vanilla and giving it a certain degree in the fragrance note.

The thought of soft sex is over. Now a very passionate thought of sex has emerged - pushing against the wall, kissing intensely and for a long time - then throwing oneself onto the bed - stressing the slats to the limit!

Narciso R. EdT is not something that comes off as dirty and cheap - no, on the contrary. It is a noble drop that carries so much softness within it that it makes the hard-boiled among us shudder. It ignites the senses and every man loves it when the bed linen smells of the woman after his veins and pupils have dilated...

The sillage is fine, the longevity is grand. I can imagine that the clothes still smell of the perfume even after a night of debauchery for at least two days.

So let it sink in until you reach the darkest spot of your soul. It will thank you for this - because Narciso EdT does not darken it, it only makes it brighter.

In this sense - I jump off the carousel and am still quite confused. A perfume that carries no hardness within it yet can dominate with its softness. I am slowly coming to my senses. Returning to the ground...

I would shine even in the glow of hell... But only with her. Only with the woman who reaches my heart with her skillful, feminine manner. Who gently woos me - lets me fall again and again - then takes my hand again and returns to the carousel.
Narciso R. Edt - You are unique and I am addicted to you!

I admit it!

Twelve years have passed,
twelve years without seeing,
twelve years without smelling,
twelve years missed,
but now I have it in my hand, the happiness-bringer in a black silk dress.
I must confess that it has already been half a year since I first had Narciso Rodriguez under my nose on a test strip. At that moment, it already had a bit of a wow effect because I had never smelled a fragrance like this before.
A black heavy bottle protects this very beautiful women's fragrance like a bodyguard and gives off a minimalistically elegant impression, somewhat resembling the simplicity of Chanel's bottles.
Narciso Rodriguez for Her is a dark women's fragrance, without really appearing dark.
It has a very straightforward elegance with a very present aura that can make a woman shine irresistibly without being intrusive.
An elegant lady, dressed seductively in black silk, gracefully descends the stairs in her villa with an elegant presence. Her long, slightly wavy black hair
seems to flow with the black silk on her skin. A breeze breathes life into her dress, making it look as if she is gliding down the stairs. Darkly made-up eyes gaze at me from a pale face, whose lips are dipped in a dark red. My heart seems to stop for a moment, my breath catches. Time seems to stand still. Only the pendulum of the large grandfather clock in the foyer seems to move back and forth. My heartbeat synchronizes with the pendulum of the clock and brings me back to the here and now. Sunbeams break in the window and fall on her pale face, illuminating her beauty.
The scent of citrus fruits paired with floral nuances of roses swirls in the air, where the sweetness of a ripe peach joins to leave a fruity-floral odor in the top note. Her movements are like those of a fairy, her eyes are as deep as the sea, and I threaten to drown in them. The heavy sweetness of amber and musk envelops my nose and makes her visage appear irresistible; I am captivated by her beauty.
Like a balm, this fragrance lays a film over all the objects and people in the foyer, bringing warmth and coziness to this very high-ceilinged hall. With grace, she glides past me and completes her scent with noble woods and an aromatic vanilla, keeping a green nuance in reserve. This fragrance does not fall short of the shine and beauty of this mysterious lady for a single second. Narciso Rodriguez for Her is capable of giving every woman this beauty and mysterious aura, making her shine irresistibly and seductively. A fragrance that puts men in a dream and can see the true beauty of every woman. A very sensual, erotic oriental fragrance that honors the female gender as it deserves. For Her only emphasizes the beauty of every woman and accompanies her with a balm-like indulgence throughout the day, and thanks to its strong sillage, it does not let men pass by emotionlessly. A very beautiful fragrance from which I wish to have a similarly for Him variant.

review_title: Domino Day at the Hairdresser or Feminine-Masculine in Its Most Beautiful Form
review_content: It was truly not love at first sniff. I remember well the first time, it was about a year ago. With the Wish by Chopard that I had purchased at that time, I received a sample of this fragrance. At that time, it couldn't be sweet enough, so it was quite uncharted territory with for her. I briefly tested it and passed it on to a friend in disgust. Wow, what is that? So...

review_title: A Clean Pig for the Dirty Ones
review_content: Well, that's how it is: what JPG's Classique is for some, is for others (or just me..) For Her edt. Pure temptation, seduction, wicked sensuality. The scent of freshly washed sheets, in which two not-so-fresh lovers lie. Clean laundry in a dirty way, so to speak. This is probably due to the incredibly fluffy-transparent musk, which still somehow feels dense. The bergamot and...

Since I love fragrances not just as perfume but in general, I ordered some pleasantly scented Yankee Candles and other scented candles online for the cold season. Along with the candles, I was kindly sent two perfume samples, which were very welcome. I always look forward to discovering new scents. One of these samples, which Flaconi provided me, was For Her by Narciso Rodriguez.
Right upon spraying, I felt as if I had stepped into a bouquet of spring flowers. Memories of Pleasures by Estée Lauder come flooding back. Yes, there it is again, that unmistakable clarity. The scent feels clean and subtle. So far, that's my first impression, which I can't rationally explain. Because in terms of composition, the two have little in common. Pleasures starts with a lot of green notes, violet leaf, and white lily, while For Her opens with bergamot, orange blossom, and osmanthus. Surprisingly, I notice little bergamot, even though I usually identify this citrus note quite quickly. However, the orange blossom, which I appreciate much less, also stays very much in the background. What seems to connect both perfumes is a rather unsweet freshness that soon becomes rosy. In Pleasures, it's rose and peony that make their grand, romantic appearance. Here, it must be the less romantic osmanthus, I think.
For Her briefly takes on a somewhat fruity character in the soon-to-emerge base note, which I can't explain from the ingredients either. Then, a dry, powdery sweetness develops that is very natural and has come to stay. It could be mimosa. Or daffodil. In any case, I am now surrounded by a pleasant, delicate soapy scent that is now revealing its uniqueness. Unknown flowers are opening up, which at least I cannot identify. The blend has something exquisite, noble, expensive - definitely unusual.
The scent has picked up speed, or so it seems to me, having found itself after all those detours. And it has matured. Still, it lacks no temperament. It has something new, striking, interesting, original, is trendy, yet always remains polished and unobtrusive. This sounds contradictory, but it is not, as everything unites in a kind of refined cheerfulness. Ideal for work in the management level or at board meetings. Elegant, but not too classic. A balancing act along the mainstream, it never pushes itself to the forefront. The freshness is long gone and has made way for a subtle exoticism that presents itself very forcefully in its dark presence.
In other words: The scent is quite pleasant, clear, straightforward, but also elitist, yes, dominant. It has nothing playful about it, rather something serious, determined, self-assured. Coquetry is foreign to it. In this sense, it is more suitable for mature personalities, which I don't necessarily mean in terms of age.
The sweetness is ultimately characterized by woody tones. The patchouli makes it earthy and quirky.
The unusual scent undoubtedly has a high recognition factor. I would call it heavy and strong. Perhaps too strong. At least for me. Not even the musk is sweet, but clearly black. For Her is striking, not easily categorized, irritating, uncompromising. Such a scent must be liked and, above all, worn. I miss the lovely, gentle aspect that I would have at least expected from the vanilla, which I can't recognize anyway. For me, For Her is too unwieldy, too challenging. I miss the smile, the charm, the flirt, a subtle eroticism and feminine sensuality in this scent. We are not made for each other. If this scent were a woman, we probably wouldn't become friends.
I hope no one will hate me for saying that the woman I could imagine wearing For Her would be Snow White's stepmother. However, the scent lacks all demonic, mysterious qualities that would suit a witch. What makes me think of the evil stepmother is also the unexpected coldness. Amber, musk, vanilla, and patchouli usually give a perfume warmth, even to the fiery, passionate extent. Here, you feel the coldness of determination. The woman who wears For Her cannot be imagined as hesitant or moody. Mood swings are foreign to her. She knows what she wants and has the strength to get it or assert herself.
Those who identify more with the poor, innocently persecuted Snow White will probably be too weak for this harsh, angular scent...

Today, a little tester of this fragrance fluttered into my home.
I unpacked it right away and sprayed it on.
Mmhh... A wonderfully delicate scent caresses my nose.
But wait a minute... I know this scent!
So I took another sniff.
I couldn’t quite place it at first.
But then...
Yes, it’s Lovely by Sarah Jessica Parker.
For Her actually smells very similar, but without the overpowering woody note that has always bothered me about Lovely.
For me, it’s a scent a bit like baby oil. Soft and sweet.
Simply wonderful.
Lovely never made it into my collection because of that strong woody note that I didn’t like, but the scent has never let me go.
So I’m even more excited to have discovered For Her for myself.
It definitely has what it takes to end up in my collection soon.

For Her and I, we have known each other for quite a while.

Many encounters in life, whether with people or fragrances, turn out to be fleeting or companions for a season. And then there is the one who patiently waits in the background, who is always there, and has always felt like it. The one who understands you without needing a grand stage, who grounds you when you need support, who wipes the tears from your face when you are sad, looks deep into your eyes, and says that everything will be alright again, one day. And you believe him because you just know he is right.
He also accompanies you in good times. This love is not passionate, but it is real. And lasting. And on a level that all other encounters, which started off blazing and fiery, never reached.

I got to know the fragrance, like so many others, through a colleague who always over-applied it. No joke, even the samples she brought to the lab smelled of it. However, she never revealed the name of the perfume, but everyone knew whether she was there, or whether she had been there that day.

I had never heard of Narciso Rodriguez before, and through a sample from Douglas, I discovered which mysterious scent it was by chance, and I was already working somewhere else - so our paths came together. Because when a fragrance is so much claimed by someone else in your environment, I hesitate to use it. You surely know that feeling.

What I particularly like about For Her is this bitter note in the base, which causes many problems for others. I can't perceive a great scent evolution here, except that the opening with osmanthus can be quite loud and a bit overwhelming. However, that settles down after about half an hour, and then it remains as it is.

Patchouli is subtly in the background, as is the amber; the main actor is clearly musk, and somewhat "dirty," physical, alluring. This note particularly emerges after many hours, best at the hairline the next morning, or on clothing (on which it lasts for days, by the way). Actually, musk is not really my thing, especially not the white one. This one is different. Many talk about the "Narciso musk." I can't judge, as I don't like the other Narciso fragrances.

I can imagine that the fragrance has an effect on men, also because it is not so "in your face" sexy, but more subtle. To perceive this sultry musk, one must get quite close to the wearer, as the scent does not radiate as much in this phase as it did at the beginning. I love this so much; For Her harmonizes so wonderfully with my skin that it becomes more of a "body scent" than a perfume - I can't describe it well, maybe you know what I mean.

The longevity and sillage are enormous for an EdT. You will definitely be noticed; even hours later, the molecules of the scent linger in the room, and sensitive noses will pick this up. If you don't overdo it, I can imagine For Her in just about any life situation, especially at work, as it radiates strength and seriousness due to its bitter note. By the way, I don't find it cool at all. A bit distant perhaps, but only in its projection. On the skin, it is warm, woody, and erotic. Two sides of a fragrance, if you will.

The bottle is timelessly beautiful; Narciso Rodriguez has created a true classic with For Her that I hope will never be discontinued.

For Her is not the type you hitchhike through South America with. Nor is it the one with whom you maintain a casual affair. For Her is the one you marry.

Actually, such scents are not really my preferred direction, but I've been lingering here with my nose on my wrist for quite a while and find the perfume fascinating. Even though there is nothing fresh, nothing green, nothing dark, and nothing mystical about it, For Her EdT is wonderfully soft, powdery, and reminds me of the feeling of cashmere on the skin.

We can safely overlook the honey in the top note; it hardly comes to the fore, but the relatively simple flowers quickly merge with the rather extraordinary heart note. Orange blossoms take center stage here. Amber and musk are usually experienced only in the base, but here they give the fragrance volume and sophistication right from the start. For Her is rounded off with very subtle woody notes. Relatively simple, yet cleverly crafted, it results in a perfume that I could very well imagine as a winter scent - even though it would completely fall outside my collection. Powdery, skin-like, and incredibly elegant!

For me, this is further proof that one should not always test in one direction, but be open to all new scent experiences.

review_title: Gift for my favorite female nose
review_content:
My girlfriend is rather the minimalist and pragmatic type when it comes to perfumes. Not entirely selfless, I introduced her to both versions of "For Her," both the Eau de Toilette and the Eau de Parfum, for testing some time ago.
While the Eau de Parfum met with restrained pleasure due to the slightly musty peach, the Eau de Toilette was a hit, especially regarding the more beautiful bottle!

A little aside: I tend to be more classically inclined when it comes to scents. For men, I prefer something spicy, dry, unsweetened, while for women, I love to smell light to opulent floral fragrances or sometimes a sensual gourmand.

Now, back to the fragrance...
The Eau de Toilette impresses with a fantastically full floral note, osmanthus and orange bloom in full splendor. In the heart note, the scent becomes softer and warmer, without losing too much of its top note, while amber and musk enhance its slightly powdery sensuality. It becomes subtly vanilla towards the end, as "For Her" fades away after many, many sensual, floral hours.
In my opinion, "For Her" is best suited for autumn and winter, perhaps also for early spring. At temperatures beyond the 20 °C mark, this fragrance could feel too heavy and too overwhelming, perhaps even too "dark".

...when the stylish little bottle finally appeared in one of her boots two weeks ago on St. Nicholas Day, we both found an olfactory fulfillment. She is thrilled, and I can hardly keep my nose away from her. ;D

- or in other words: the tailored suit among fragrances, where the top button of the blazer can remain unbuttoned to reveal a glimpse of the lace top underneath.

Sometimes I have to force myself to find happiness. In the form of blind purchases. I try to keep my collection as balanced as possible, even though my love for powdery-sweet, warm scents is clearly evident. So sometimes I visit the local perfumery with a clear goal: I am looking for an elegant office scent. - In the end, I test my way through the selection and probably end up choosing another flanker that I already have in a similar version five times in my collection. Therefore, I also like to order blindly based on reviews in this forum. Especially when there is an attractive offer. This was also the case with “For Her EdT,” and a 50ml bottle found its way into my possession - in the hope of finally having found an elegant office scent.

The start of our story was bumpy. After the first testing attempts, the scent quickly ended up in the closet. Whether on clothing or skin - it was hardly perceptible to me. A hint of nothing. A trace of musk and that was it. If I hadn't known that the seller sold 100% genuine products, I would have thought the scent was a fake. But I quickly realized that I was the problem - the rest of my family could perceive it. Some described it as very delicate, while others even found it quite intense. Thus, “For Her EdT” led a miserable existence in the closet, at least for a few months. Then I gave it another chance, and this time I could perceive it; the spell seemed broken.

The first impression? Delicate floral body powder with a large dose of musk. Powdery, woody, well-groomed, slightly sultry, and somehow cool - distant. I perceive a rosy note - however, it is not pure and clear. Much more, it is a dark rose, without a fabric softener note. The scent does not leave a noteworthy scent trail on my skin - the first impression remains. The longevity is good, lasting up to 8/9 hours. The sillage is good - it is not overwhelming, but it is noticeable.

I find that “For Her EdT” is a very beautiful and unique scent. So well-groomed and clean, yet not pure. No, rather it comes across as distant, dark, and even a bit sultry. Dark roses, powder, and lots of musk. Not sweet and straightforward. Classic, sophisticated, elegant, and somehow also sexy. In a very grown-up way. It radiates confidence and class, which makes it so attractive.

I appreciate it and wear it on days when I want to feel particularly grown-up and elegant. Especially confident and classy.

Mission office scent? Check.

review_title: The "little black dress" in my collection
review_content:
I rarely approach people about fragrances. However, a few years ago, I kept noticing the scent of a colleague. It was easily detectable without being overpowering, so I always knew in the stairwell if she was ahead of me. She revealed to me that it was Narciso Rodriguez "For her" Eau de Parfum. Never heard of it, so a few days later after work, I sprayed the fragrance in a nearby perfume shop and headed home. Oh wow! As good as it was on her, in the office air and in theory, unfortunately, I didn’t like it on myself. What a great scent! But the rose was just too dominant for me, and so it slipped into oblivion.

Fast forward 2 years later, I stumbled upon a fragrance review of the "For her" EdT and clicked on it for nostalgic reasons. Ah, the scent that is so beautiful, but I just don’t like it on myself… There I read with astonishment that the EdT and the EdP differ quite a bit, someone mentioned that particularly the prominent rose note in the EdT had been toned down, but the longevity was comparable to that of the EdP. The rest of the story is history…

The Narciso Rodriguez "For her" EdT is a truly wonderful fragrance that - I would claim - suits many women very well. A very voluminous and luxurious scent, the musk is clearly perceptible from start to finish. Floral-powdery with a certain sweetness and yet somehow cool. It changes little in the first hours, then towards the end becomes a cozy woody patchouli-musk-powder. A scent that is very difficult for me to describe, but it has a massive recognition value. It is dark, herb-sweet-creamy, yet very clean, sensual, and distinctly feminine. For me, it is the "little black dress" among my fragrances. Not a classic scent in that sense, but very seductive, feminine, and mature, yet tidy and clear.

Longevity is unbeatable for me for an EdT, 5-7 hours without a doubt, and even in the evening, you can still smell it on the wrist. Sillage is definitely there; personally, I don’t want to scent my entire surroundings, so I dose it sparingly, and yet it is perceived within a radius of a few meters. For me, it is more of an evening or occasion scent, which I also like to wear at home. In the office, I usually prefer "Pure Musc," which is a bit tamer and less opulent.

For those who do not like overly sweet, heavy, oriental scents but are still looking for a more potent candidate that doesn’t smell ordinary and that you might actually get approached about, check it out! Unreserved recommendation from me. One of my declared favorites.

At first, it's a total "flower overload," but then the floral notes really unfold, and the woodiness mixes in, skillfully blending with the blossoms, making it feel a bit ethereal for me.

The soft, fine musk layer elegantly wraps around the floral-woody mixture, making the scent cozy and definitely a companion for everyday wear that suits any occasion.

I didn't even know it was over 20 years old; I thought it was younger. But it's good that I didn't know it back then; I surely wouldn't have bought it, as I preferred more masculine perfumes at that time.
But, as the saying goes, you get older and perhaps a bit wiser; now I really enjoy these very feminine scents, and this one is perfect for Easter. It brings joy and good spirits-what more could you want?

I wish you all a happy Easter festival with lots of colorful eggs and friendly rays of sunshine.

When it comes to perfumes that smell like rose, it's a tricky matter for me. I absolutely do not like the scent of Bulgarian rose (think, the scent of Chloé?), but when I sniff a real rose at the nursery or on the farm, I find the scent incredibly beautiful; however, I find it hard to replicate that in perfumeries.
Unfortunately, many perfumes lean towards that Chloé direction, which I strongly reject. And I must say, For her smells very much like that to me, even though rose does not appear in the notes.
However, For her is slightly different in some respects, and that's why it's a perfume I enjoy wearing. It is woodier, powdery, and also smells very mature and sophisticated.
I also notice a huge similarity to Modern Muse by Estée Lauder.
The longevity is unbelievable. I treated myself to a half spray on the back of my hand for a quick refresh, and it really stays very present. I think this is the strongest perfume I own, and the sillage is also enormous. If I can't smell it anymore, I can rely on the fact that other people in the room still have it in their noses.
And to sum it up, anyone who loves roses will be very well served here.

review_title: You Fill My Heart with Love!
review_content:
According to Xavier, we are all born for love. Well, I completely agree with that. Unfortunately, neither Love nor Peace reaches every inhabitant of this planet. Sadly. The dream of peace and love slumbers in many good people. Unfortunately, it is not lasting. The thought of it is also shattered. Just at the first glance when you flip through the channels. Every day, you mostly hear bad news from the radio, you look into the newspapers, always some scandals, economic debacles, disputes, war, etc.

The world is the purest disgrace, my professor once said. A highly intelligent person who not only dealt with psychosomatics but also extensively with politics and, on the side, is active in a human rights organization.

I don't want to bore you with any world stories and paint the world in a bad light. Because you know what!? With so much crap (sorry), there is always something good. Life can be so beautiful. So full of love and completely free of sorrow. Do you know those days when you get up on the right foot, slowly but surely make your way into the oh-so-evil world with some really chill music? The first rays of sunshine greet you warmly, you are flooded with light, and you keep taking deep breaths. People walk back and forth, sneaking past you. Some even take the trouble to smile. Yes, it’s nice to be smiled at for a change. You suddenly don’t notice the noise of the city anymore, as you are well-rested and your body is completely rejuvenated. Great! I love this feeling and the thought that I am feeling so good. The body and soul are much more relaxed. Some tension just falls away from me!

On some good days, as well as nights, I put on For Her EdT. My mood skyrockets because I feel so much love for this perfume. From the very beginning, it left a fantastic impression on me. My fiancé was also so enthusiastic about the scent, and so far, I have already emptied two large bottles. I will surely be stocked up with For Her until death.

I like the pleasantness that For Her offers. It starts so harmoniously, and it’s as if the orange is whispering something in your ear. The perfume seems graceful and youthful to me. Something dark spreads in For Her, but somehow it also appears radiant to me. A bright spot in the black nothingness! That hits the nail on the head, in my opinion! Beautiful but slowly, this unmistakable musk comes into play and makes it more mature, cuddly, and above all, sensual. It also becomes powdery and makes my mood do daring somersaults when it goes there. So beautifully powdered, as if a shower of rose petals is falling on you, all surrounded by fine powder that gently lingers in the air... Then wood sneaks in, making it stronger and more dominant. However, the scent never slips into the masculine. It remains feminine, very steadfast, and still very alluring. The male world loves it. My husband is eating out of my hand when I wear For Her. Those are such beautiful moments in life. He holds on to me for a long time and surrounds me with his very own way. For Her EdT has a high recognition value, and I would also perceive it from afar!

But sometimes I just want to be alone when I wear this scent. I just want to have it for myself. To feel the scent on me, to truly perceive it, without any distractions. I can only do this when I am completely alone and really give myself to the scent. For that, I tune into Xavier and let myself be entertained. However, this does not diminish the relationship with the perfume.

Actually, we could all fly.. Yes! Why not?
Through pink, powdery musk clouds that linger above us!
You must live your life
Or this life will do with you what it wants
You can surpass everyone
When you fly, everything becomes so reverently still

With my soul, you are heart-touchingly loving
When I see you, you fill my heart to the brim with love!

AND ABOVE ALL WHEN I SMELL YOU!

I had to approach this fragrance slowly. The first time, the soapy musk overwhelmed me. So this is the highly praised Narciso musk?! I don’t want to smell like soap.
But the scent develops so wonderfully when my beloved Osmanthus takes away the sharpness, and then the fragrance comes across as both zesty and softly floral. Cool sexiness fits perfectly. Longevity 8h, top for an EDT! In South China, the Osmanthus blooms in winter. The wind carries the wonderful scent for miles, and thanks to this perfume, it now reaches my home as well.

I had underestimated DEN all along! Only "beautiful"? Or extravagantly fantastic? Probably somewhere in between, but much closer to the fantastic! On one side very cool, almost frosty. This must be due to the musk that scatters its ice powder. On the other side dark and slightly smoky with a dark red glow from within. THESE ARE ROSES!! I think, even though there are none listed in the fragrance pyramid "on top"! A bit defiant comes the answer to my own, uncertain question: I SMELL THEM, SO THEY ARE THERE!! Only to then dive back down to resurface later. Surreal? Maybe! Yet the aura is not sweet. A tiny little bit perhaps, with a lot of imagination. Now I return to the "fantastic." To be precise: When the osmanthus appears, I have something slightly smoky in my nose! Or is it rather the amber and patchouli? Or all together? Now the bitter roses are back and unite with the little "sweet" and the warmer notes, only to later switch to the "ice musk." The impression is one of oscillation. Sometimes almost stroboscopic "flashlights"... And it continues to rumble beneath the cool surface, one thinks something sweet must be coming... but now it’s musk-amber-patchouli powder, looming in the cool room, trying to warm it up. Osmanthus always in sight... Then again the now patchoulized roses... Nothing sweet, but a lot of powder!
Fascinating? Of course!! :-))

review_title: A Long Day with For Her...
review_content: I tested For Her EDT a long time ago. I didn't find it bad, but it wasn't really wearable for me. So I put it aside for now... Until today... I am currently looking for a fragrance that goes in a different direction. Maybe something more special, not as sweet and floral as my other friends. So off to the beautiful department stores I went. Well, I have to say that the...

I was curious when a sample of this fragrance came into my hands, as the previous reviews sounded very promising and made me eager to get my own impression of this obviously very unconventional Eau de Toilette. And then I was surprised, because what unexpectedly hit my nose after spraying was a lily of the valley - a white, powdery little flower, not listed here but completely...

When storms rage outside,
you are my anchor

When the earth shakes,
you are my ground

When it becomes dark around me,
you are my light.

What power lies dormant in some fragrances.
I have never felt so secure and protected by a scent. This one wanted to conquer me. But I played hard to get. For a while. Yet it kept appearing before me, and so I eventually succumbed to it.
It has something that sets it apart from the mainstream and makes it special. The elegant black cloak it is wrapped in could not be more fitting. It is mysterious and opaque and does not simply reveal what lies beneath. One must earn the insight.

The elegantly floral opening immediately makes it clear that this is a strong fragrance that seeks and needs attention. The interplay of bergamot, orange blossom, and osmanthus opens the olfactory experience. To my nose, loud, intense, and demanding. And very alluring! When their grip loosens a bit, amber and musk caress. However, they never overpower but skillfully blend harmoniously with the opening notes. The, in my opinion, classically floral touch thus remains intact and is balanced at the end with vanilla. It does not appear in the usual and well-known sweet style but rather seems noble and refined. This vanillic cotton is not a pink cotton candy; this one is made of pure gold! This valuable and noble aspect receives a dignified and slightly bitter "finish" from vetiver, preventing a drift into an overwhelming sweetness. And so, everything in this composition remains intact for me. The scent no longer changes and accompanies me throughout the day. Even though it is sparingly dosed, it effortlessly showcases its full potential. Clothes, scarves, even a test strip in my handbag still smell days later and remind me of the occasion when I wore it.
It has an effect on me that makes me feel: anything is possible.
It has now reached the point where I wear it to particularly demanding meetings, job interviews, or simply in moments when I need special strength. I feel completely comfortable with this scent; self-doubt disappears, and I am one with the world.
I seem to radiate this as well. When I wear it, I am noticed. Everything comes to me more easily.
It is as if it protects me under a cloak.
Its cloak of black velvet...

I believe it was about 15 years ago when I first walked past a woman while shopping and thought - I want to smell like her!! A clean, well-groomed scent, not too overpowering, creamy… almost so subtle that it could have been her fabric softener. This scent kept coming back to me, and sometimes I even dared to approach the ladies, but unfortunately, different fragrances emerged, though often NR variants. Mh strange… when I had freshly sprayed the mentioned fragrances, they didn't smell at all like THE scent.

About the EDT:
A very floral, even slightly soapy scent, but with an edge. For me, it's not an "Easy Grab" or "Everyday Wear." I find it very chic, cool, almost prim and yet sexy. How does that work together? It fits perfectly with the sexy secretary, wearing glasses, a bun, and a white blouse. One button undone more than is proper and a strand of hair that keeps slipping into her face. When she crosses her legs, you might catch a glimpse of the garter on her thigh. So “lady in the streets, but freak in the sheets.”
For me, extraordinarily feminine. However, the scent has no age limits for me and no specific season. The H+S are beast mode.

Now I come to my fragrance puzzle… after wearing the scent for a whole day, I woke up at some point during the night and - THERE WAS MY CLEAN SCENT! I am just totally into the Narciso Musk that always comes out at the very end for me with every NR. And you know what? The Pure Musc even smells exactly like that from the very beginning :)

review_title: Started strong and then became even stronger...
review_content:
..this time I changed the office joke a bit and turned it upside down.

For Him had been on my testing list for a while, even though Musc for Him did not convince me at all, but anything with Kurkdjian's name on it I have to test. Unfortunately, two weeks ago at Müller the tester was empty, and that resulted in a Shalimar purchase (but let's just make a big detour around that topic;-)).

I was all the more curious about the decant of Hasi & Mrs. Piggy from For Her. Especially since Mrs. Nagel was involved, who had previously excited me about the Lalique products..especially White! So the combination of Nagel-Kurkdjian..it simply had to be good.

It was not only good, but simply outstanding. A women's fragrance in which I could almost lie down to absorb it with all my senses..yes, to soak it up.

Wonderful zesty bergamot and osmanthus form the very lively opening. Osmanthus gives a non-citrusy fresh note..even slightly aquatic. The Different Company has dedicated an entire perfume to this note, which I found, similar to Kurkdjian's Acqua series, to be far too little as a scent..as a full-fledged perfume. Here it seems very concentrated to me and creates a beautiful contrast to the citrusy bergamot right from the start.

Just a few minutes later, For Her gets a creamy-powdery floral touch. This note is the heart of this fragrance..it remains the defining and characterizing note throughout. Musk merely adds the necessary depth, making it more dimensional..i.e., the fragrance appears more complex and lasts longer, and the wonderful blend of fragrance notes feels very dense and lush, which can be clearly seen from the excellent sillage. This will completely fill a car or the office with 2-3 sprays..I still can't imagine an overdose with this scent, as the fragrance notes smell too noble, too expensive, and high-quality...they seem intense to me but not overpowering...unless you reapply the scent in the elevator;-)

If the creamy orange blossom were not quite so feminine and the musk a tad stronger, For Her could also be worn by men. But the orange blossom becomes too floral and creamy-powdery (I'll refrain from the inflationary comparison with Dior Homme at this point).

No matter..it does say that it is for women..men can just stick to that..men only need a clear message(s) and then they know what's what;-).

In the end, For Her even becomes slightly cool without being able to name which fragrance note (mini lily of the valley note?) is responsible for it..because I can't detect vetiver, and vanilla certainly not..that would be more of a warm note.

For Her is a wonderful perfume that is ideal for autumn and winter. Even today, with a gray sky and damp, cold 12 degrees, there can hardly be a better choice. Therefore, the 100% is obviously due...and let's see if there will be a new tester for For Him next week!?!

This fragrance was introduced to me when I asked for "something different than usual" a few years ago in a mainstream perfumery. For Her is indeed a distinctive scent.

The top note starts with orange blossoms dipped in honey. The honey is very mild and not overly sweet. You are surrounded by a warm, soft aura. Gradually, amber joins in, along with an intense musk note. However, it never becomes too intense, as it is held in check by woods.

The fragrance has incredible sillage and longevity, so it should be applied sparingly. One spray is enough. You have to like it when people say to you: "You left the room, but your scent is still here!" For Her is definitely not an inconspicuous little water.

I would like it even more if the top note lasted a bit longer.
Since I sometimes get headaches from the scent, I prefer to spray it on my clothes, which I can change if my brain cells disagree with my fragrance choice again.

Nevertheless, thumbs up for a soft, creamy, warm, sensual, not overly sweet fragrance with longevity and sillage that is suitable as a signature scent because it is simply always wearable!

After I recently enjoyed a wonderful end to the day with Narciso EDT, and the Essence always provided a pleasantly warm, soft coolness, I confidently tried for her EDT this evening. But while the two fragrances mentioned earlier take a polite step back, for her loudly calls: Here! I am irritated by its attention deficit syndrome, as it really doesn't need to be that way. The...

I received this fragrance as a recommendation from the aforementioned perfume seller; she said it was something completely different, not like the conventional perfumes. Until then, I had never heard of Narciso Rodriguez, but that didn't deter my adventurous spirit.

Upon first contact with the EdT, I thought: No way, this is a bit too extreme for me. But as fate would have it, the bottle still found its way to me, and I have no regrets. It’s not a scent for every day, and I had to be in the right mood for it, but it definitely had that certain something. I wore it very happily when I was in the mood and even received a compliment or two for it. Recently, I even considered buying it again, but the world of perfumes is soooo vast that I’d rather try something new. All in all, though, it’s a beautiful, interesting fragrance with many facets.

a perfume friend gave me a small sample about 2 years ago, at that time the scent seemed unpleasant to me. I suspect it was the musk that I couldn't tolerate or didn't understand, and so the sample disappeared into the bathroom cabinet.
