I forced my boyfriend, who unfortunately is not a fan of perfumes at all, to choose at least one scent from my perfume collection that I could "wear" in his vicinity, and he chose the For Her (Eau de Toilette) by Narciso Rodriguez. Frustrated, I sprayed a bit on my neck and BOOM, I fell in love at first sniff! How can a perfume with only four notes smell so deep and multifaceted? It starts off floral-fresh for me and ends up totally sensual and seductive. The scent never becomes too much or too overpowering for me. In every season and mood, I only want to smell like For Her, and my boyfriend doesn't leave my side when I wear it. It's also great as an office scent; I've received many compliments thanks to it! Unfortunately, unfortunately, the longevity is mediocre.

No other fragrance of mine gives me this feeling like "for her", I have no idea where it comes from, but when I wear it, I immediately feel a bit better. It envelops me and I feel secure. It’s not the individual notes, but the "whole package".
The calming effect showed itself to me a few years ago when I had a trial work day and was quite nervous. I hadn’t applied any perfume myself because I didn’t know how it would be received, but one of the potential new colleagues smelled of "for her" and suddenly everything didn’t seem so bad anymore.

The opening is dominated by orange blossom and a hint of bergamot, after that I only smell a wonderful amber, vanilla, and musk scent that I want to snuggle into.
That’s why I would describe this perfume as my signature scent, not because I wear it every day, but simply because it is a part of me and works wonderfully on me.
And thus it has perfectly achieved its goal with me.

Addendum 2017: still my "home" scent. No other has pushed it off its throne so far. For me, it’s a comforting fragrance. Even though I use it rather rarely at the moment, I still smell it from the bottle now and then....

.. that's how many good stories begin... including mine, which is connected to this fragrance...
I go back to my memory about 18 years ago...
It was a cozy Saturday evening, a few friends came to visit, there was delicious food, too much wine, and some stories from life, we hadn't seen each other for a while; one of my friends "floated in," enveloped in an unbelievably good-smelling cloud of fragrance.. I looked at her fascinated and asked her about her scent, which completely blew me away... I had never smelled anything so wonderful before. She said, slightly flattered by my enthusiasm, "Narciso R. for Her." Aha... never heard of it, and as it turned out, the fragrance wasn't even available here yet; she had brought it from the USA as a flight attendant, and once again, they were ahead of the times. I was totally hooked and tried to get the fragrance IMMEDIATELY, which felt like it took an eternity (about 3 months, so for a WOMAN, that's forever, chuckle). But eventually, I held my fragrance treasure in my hand, sprayed the first spritz from the deep black bottle, and waited in full anticipation for the WOW effect, that catapulting back to the first evening of OUR encounter... indeed, it took a few minutes during which I irritably thought it was the wrong fragrance, similar but somehow different, until suddenly the super scent I remembered revealed itself, and I recalled the first moment of our meeting.
For me, this fragrance was for a long time THE fragrance par excellence and accompanied me through my eventful life for the next 15 years. The dear friend is no longer (for me) around (I hope she is healthy and well), we lost touch, but I think of her fondly every time I apply Narciso R. for Her, reminding me of that one moment of getting to know each other... intertwined with the person who wore it back then, a wonderful woman.
What does "for Her" smell like to me? It is a very multifaceted fragrance, starting with floral, rather cool notes, slightly soapy, but in a pleasant way, and then becoming a bit warmer, slightly woody, somehow very feminine, a bit sexy yet office-appropriate... is that even possible? For many years, it was an all-rounder for me, suitable for every occasion, in everyday life, on dates, in very intimate moments (often emphasized with the matching, slightly muskier shower gel and body lotion), I wore it often and with pleasure. By now, I have probably outgrown this fragrance, my interests have changed, a new chapter in life began at some point, along with my willingness to embrace new, completely different scent experiences. What remains is the memory of very beautiful experiences, a time when much seemed possible and some things actually happened... it was exciting... and "for Her" has faithfully accompanied me, like a good friend does... thank you, my dear, for this beautiful experience and the many memories intertwined with it.

or does it?
It has been several years since I first smelled Narciso.
Captivating, enchanting, I was completely taken by this intense fragrance of independence and strength.

It didn't take long, and he became mine and lived with me.
That time was a period of upheaval for me; theatrically expressed, I felt like the rise of the phoenix from the ashes, full of virtue, freedom, strength, and truth, and he was always by my side.
Although Narciso has relatively little in common with mythological birds, he represented all of that.

I was often approached, "what smells so good," which brought a smile to my face every time, as I felt the same way.
Yes, it was love.

As time goes on, he faded more and more.
Just as I changed, he changed, until he completely disappeared.
I became acquainted with the powdery sister and the
floral cousin, and took this as an opportunity not too long ago to reignite the old love.
What can I say - old love never rusts, but it does change.
And so he remains in my closet, sometimes taken out and sniffed, but only for the sake of memory.

Narciso Rodriguez' for her charges ahead at a rapid pace
of musk and has endurance and consistency.
For me today, a bit "too much."
But it was a beautiful time!

Since my impressions from yesterday are still very fresh, I am delivering the comment on the more naive EdT today. The lighter version also performs very well, although not quite as special, unique, and distinctive as the EdP. But since most of it applies to both, the comment will be a bit shorter here. Here I am reminded more of Guerlain's Petite Robe Noir than with the EdP....

review_title: Clean Scent Without Lily of the Valley
review_content:
For Her... I'm just going to put this out there... is the essence of clean, moisturized, powdered, pleasantly scented baby bottom. The loud call for cream scent is clearly answered here. For Her has absolutely nothing messed up about it, and that’s refreshing.

Thanks to my smoker's nose, I can't actually describe any individual scent notes, at most I perceive lily of the valley. Cool, they’re not even listed. Yeah, right.
That's why it won't surprise anyone that I don't notice a difference between the EdP and the EdT, not even in longevity.

(I'm going to go shame myself for a bit, smoke a pack of Black Krausen, and order everything from Nasomatto.)

Before I forget, For Her is a truly delightful, long-lasting fragrance that I love very much, even though they forgot to note the lily of the valley.

This fragrance has been one of my favorites since I discovered it.
I read about this scent in a forum. It was not available at Douglas for a long time and also not in online shops. In any case, it was not available in every perfumery.

Then I eventually saw it at Douglas and had to sniff it right away. I fell in love immediately. Every breath was infused with this scent.
I generally like fragrances that have musk and amber. But in "For Her," in my opinion, the combination of these two components is the best achieved. I wear this perfume in winter and autumn, as it is a bit too heavy for the warm seasons.

For me, "For Her" is the epitome of femininity. My male colleagues constantly compliment me on my perfume. I always need to have this scent; otherwise, I feel incomplete.

I used For Her not too often, but regularly, for about 2 to 3 years. This perfume is not suitable for every occasion, every person, and every day… This fragrance was launched in the USA at the end of 2003 (EdP at the end of 2005). Narciso Rodriguez is a well-known high-class fashion label in the USA. The fragrance is available in both 50ml and 100ml. The bottles are simple,...

It is the year 2004. A short trip to Edinburgh/Scotland with my then best friend.
We are strolling through a truly magnificent department store in the city center when a somewhat pushy saleswoman thrusts a scent strip with the latest mainstream fragrance at me. I had already preferred more classic/vintage scents back then and was pretty sure this wouldn’t be for me. The first impression seemed to confirm my thoughts - an intrusive, synthetic white flower hit my nose…not my thing at all. I let the test strip disappear into my bag and immediately forgot about it.
Three hours later: We are buckled up on the plane home when I notice a beautiful scent. At first, I thought it must be from another passenger, opened my bag in the meantime, and realized that the scent was rising from my bag. At that moment, I knew I absolutely had to have this fragrance! But it was too late - the plane took off… and in Germany, the fragrance was not yet available… I guarded my little test strip like a treasure and eagerly awaited its appearance on the German market… Internet orders without a credit card were not possible anyway. Eventually, the time came: I had it, and our love story lasted about 2 years… NR for her was my signature scent, for which I constantly received compliments (even from taxi drivers)… but as it sometimes goes, I eventually craved something different… by then, the fragrance had also become too popular for my taste.
After an abstinence of at least 15 years, I bought it again for the first time this month… and spontaneously fell in love again!
It is mainly the drydown that makes this fragrance so attractive to me… a rarity among mainstream scents. Sillage and longevity are top-notch… one is surrounded by a sensual, feminine aura… I just can’t let go of it! My husband, who also mainly loves vintage scents, smelled it on me for the first time today and thought it was great too…

Narciso Rodriguez "the First" is rightly a successful fragrance. When it hit the market, I thought: "Wow!", because for a mainstream scent, it smelled refreshingly different, had edges and character, and was a successful overall package of fragrance, bottle, and great body care, which is always quite important to me.
But - and here comes the big "but" - it is not suitable for the office, as I find it too overwhelming for that. I certainly can't wear it all the time; I need to be in a very good mental and physical state to do so.
It has a lot of punch, not to say - cojones, and is unmistakably unique.
The top note is very in-your-face orange blossom.
I generally like orange blossom, but in combination with osmanthus and honey, it can easily be a bit much (or overwhelming).
The heart note is already more pleasant, creamy-musk cuddly, and above all, very sexy.
The base rounds off the cuddly aspect with a hint of woodiness.
I don't find the fragrance sweet or even honey-heavy; for me, the orange blossoms and musk come through very strongly, and for the first few minutes, if not the first hour, the EdT has a tendency towards an (?) osmanthus overdose, which can prick me and perhaps my surroundings.
Otherwise, it would be a hundred percent.

The floral note at the beginning, I find not sweet at all. Together with amber and patchouli, the EDT comes across as almost herbaceous to me. That's exactly what I really like, the scent is not as sticky sweet as some women's perfumes.
Musk makes it feminine and mysterious. Rodriguez for her becomes rounded through its woody-animalic base.
I prefer the EDT over the EDP and I find it long-lasting. On clothing, it remains very noticeable for a long time.
In my opinion, it's not a scent for "little girls" ...just sexy.

I tested it out, but I don't really remember what I thought back then. It arrived 5 minutes ago and was immediately sprayed on my skin. The first thought: lilac! Wait.. that's not in there. Could it be the osmanthus? Hm, bergamot would really be preferable for me. I gradually notice how it becomes floral-powdery. I am hopefully waiting for the base. Will it manage to convince my Chanel skin chemistry? I wait and will report back!
Okay, we don't match; I feel heavily perfumed, unnatural, artificial. The scent hardly changes, but remains very present. I can't handle this "lilac" at all. Headache potential extremely high!

review_title: A Musky Bomb That Is Enchanting
review_content:
I received a sample with a fragrance order and was immediately overwhelmed.
Yes, it doesn't just smell of musk; it almost knocks you over. But only almost ;)
The scent reminds me of a walk in a flower garden on a summer afternoon. As it develops, I find the fragrance slightly fruity, although there are actually no fruits in it.
The scent is not heavy, but I wouldn't wear it at 30 degrees. More like up to 25, due to the risk of headaches because it is quite intense.
The fragrance embodies femininity in person.
The sillage is initially very strong, but it fades quite quickly for me. The longevity is also not great, lasting less than 4 hours on me.
However, since the fragrance is affordable and others rate it much better, I would recommend purchasing it.

review_title: A Charmer with a Pompous Appearance
review_content:
In my statement, I said: "Nothing special." But somehow, it still stuck with me. So instead of just a sample, I had to get a decant. Here we are:

Orange blossom and bergamot come together for a radiant, cheerful "Here I am." After about 30 minutes, osmanthus, musk, and amber bring the scent back down. It becomes warm and soft. The orange blossom-bergamot complex quietly sparkles in the background. I don't detect the powder shown above.

After two hours, I recognize the base notes as a very light woody touch. Sometimes I catch a whiff of vanilla, sometimes not... In the meantime, I notice the orange blossom more distinctly from time to time.

I would describe the scent as floral-warm-soft-lightly woody. A charmer with a pompous appearance. Not a scent I absolutely need, but it could certainly find a place in my collection.

Addendum Dec. 6, 2022: It has since been reformulated, the fragrance pyramid looks different from when this review was written.

review_title: The black bottle is just a disguise!
review_content: Dear Very, forgive me. I am being bombarded by black, masked bees that escape from the bottle and pour liters of honey over me. There are some things I don't like in perfumes (at least when they are in the majority, thus dominating a scent: lily of the valley, honey, benzoin resin, incense, and overdosed musk, sugar) Who wrote "Not sweet" here? For Her is ONLY sweet for...

Spring is coming, without a doubt. I can tell because I am excited about floral scents like never before in winter. My little lemon tree, which had to winter indoors, is bearing its first lemon blossoms. Their scent is sweet, intense, strong, and very delicious. It's as if they want to say, "look at me, smell me, I am ready for spring, for feelings, for life"! The fragrance "for her" feels just as intense and ready. Floral-intensive and sweet, for the woman who is ready to be seen, yes, to be smelled. Because she is ready for spring, for real emotions, and wants to declare this to the world. Not a scent for every day, but definitely one for bold spring feelings.

This fragrance has been with me for many years and is an absolute go-to/ everyday scent. The scent is super pleasant for me and my surroundings and never offends anyone. With it, you are always stylishly "dressed." It is feminine, confident, and sensual. We have a strong musk here, which characterizes the fragrance, along with subtle flowers in the background. By the way: I...

When I first sprayed this fragrance, I immediately had a very specific association in mind.
I saw Hela before me.
A goddess dressed in black and green, moving with smooth, predatory steps.
One who takes what she wants without compromise.
One who radiates self-confidence and exudes incredible sexiness.

Of course, I mean Hela from Marvel's "Thor Ragnarok," portrayed by Cate Blanchett.
Historically, it would probably be Hel, the goddess of death, ruler of the underworld.
However, I have no association with her, so I will stick with the fictional film character of Hela.

For me, the perfume embodies a woman who can assert herself. A woman who thinks analytically, acts decisively and purposefully.
One who possesses a healthy dose of self-confidence and never lets herself be pushed around.
At the same time, the fragrance also has a seductive sexiness that imparts a mysterious femininity.
It conveys a certain coolness, like the distant majesty of Hela, yet it never feels stiff.
After about two hours, the scent becomes closer to my skin, and I perceive a certain softness.
Does Hela have a hidden soft core?

When I wear the fragrance, it gives me a boost of self-confidence, almost like the "Hela-to-go," a bit of support from the goddess.
Even though it may sound a bit overwhelming in my description, the scent is by no means that; it is quite suitable for everyday wear and a great companion for almost any situation.
For me, it does push boundaries with its incredible self-confidence.
Sometimes it's too much for me.
Sometimes it's exactly what I need.

Living with a man who is rather indifferent to scents can be really frustrating: For months now, I've been making incredibly wonderful discoveries, constantly walking around with my wrist in front of my nose (the fact that I’m even tanned on my face this summer is a miracle), wanting to share my enthusiasm and thoughts... and the other person can at best be moved to a "Hmnja." Or (with each of my now quite numerous vanilla scents) to a "Hmnja. Heavy." Barbaric! But his comment on For Her EAU DE TOILETTE really took the cake, as he suddenly had a very definite opinion: He sniffed, sneezed, and said: "Böh. Like a sofa cushion!" Noticing my astonished look, he quickly qualified it, but not in a more sensitive way: "Like a salon!" (what he meant was "Like grandma under the arm"). We quickly ended the conversation.
I even believe I understand what he perceives: The scent is indeed very dense, sweet, velvety, tightly woven, not a trace of ethereal, fragile, floating. I don’t perceive it as a cool, career woman scent at all, but rather as warming, charmingly sexy, and even sunny (though more so in cooler temperatures). But the association with dusty furniture with the haze of a thousand behinds in it? "For Her" doesn’t deserve that. I will continue to wear it with enthusiasm!

For Her ... a fragrance that practically merges with the skin.

To me, For Her smells of intimacy. Of natural femininity. It has just the right blend of musk and light florals to not come off as too animalistic, but also not too "clean."

For Her is light and develops on my skin into a skin scent after about half an hour. What remains for the next few hours is a seductive, feminine, private fragrance. You have to come close to me to perceive it, which only confirms For Her in its sensuality. It is not an extroverted scent, and I wouldn’t describe it as elegant, but it is reserved in an inviting way. Quite refined.

review_title: I was looking for you! And then you were gone again...
review_content:
My goal was to find the perfect office scent. I am back in the office more often now and, due to my job, I am frequently on the go and in contact with clients. For that, I obviously need fragrances that work in almost any situation. Ones that appeal to almost everyone but are still not boring. A people-pleaser with style :) After reading the great reviews about For Her here in the forum, I arranged for a decant.

The first impression: great! Floral, but not too sweet. In a high-quality way floral. I also catch a subtle freshness, like just showered.

Shortly after, the heart note reveals itself. The floral aspect takes a back seat, and what remains is an elegant, self-assured, slightly smoky, cool sexiness that, like everything else about this fragrance, is not overpowering. I am thrilled!

Not even an hour later:
The scent is already a thing of the past. I have to really strain my nose to even catch a whiff of the perfume. And I really didn't hold back.
Oh, if only you weren't so fleeting!

Better late than never! Somehow, I had overlooked the black bottle so far, as I always reached for Poudree or Musc Noir Rose. Unfortunately, I find the fragrances from Narciso Rodriguez to be quite similar. I always thought that if you have one or two, you don’t necessarily need another one from the line.

Recently, I received a sample of this fragrance and tried it out. It was actually the first scent in the entire line that was not crafted in exactly the same pattern as the others. For me, it has a slightly older touch, but definitely in a good way. Upon spraying, you immediately notice that it is floral. But Osmanthus is truly something unique. This is not your typical floral scent. It smells more like a velvety flower, where you can’t quite tell what type of bloom it is. Somewhat bitter, woody, a bit peachy. And then comes this patchouli scent, which for me is the epitome of vintage. The whole thing is enveloped in amber and musk, giving it that freshness and bitterness. These notes blur the floral scent. It’s as if the lens of a camera is out of focus. A retro blend that doesn’t clearly reveal what you are actually smelling.

Because this perfume has such a mysterious, older touch, it definitely has charm. So far, it seems to be particularly well-received by older people. A scent that women from the 50s would probably have worn. I must say, it truly captures the spirit of the older generation. For me, it is a fragrance that is definitely a classic and will remain so.

I own several of the Narciso Rodriguez fragrances, which I believe are among the best designed by the brand. My favorites are Narciso EAU DE PARFUM POUDRÉE and the warm, clean musk bomb "For Her Pure Musc (Eau de Parfum) | Narciso Rodriguez." This fragrance in the black bottle is the original standard For Her scent and offers a lot.
It is a beautiful, clean, and crisp musk with floral undertones; the scent is warm yet light and powdery.
You can wear it perfectly in everyday life or for the office, I really like it. I must say that the Narciso Rodriguez fragrances are truly amazing, and I am glad to collect them, as each has its own beautiful characteristics and scent notes. They are great allrounders that have rightly become bestsellers; alongside "For Her Pure Musc (Eau de Parfum) | Narciso Rodriguez," this one often appears on the best lists, and rightly so.

~ Inspiration ~
After testing the EDP and finding it too strong, I read here that the EDT is supposed to be the softer version.

~ Bottle ~
The simple design is the same as the EDP, but the EDT is now in black. It appears more elegant, and one might assume due to the dark color that it is also heavier.

~ Scent ~
Upon spraying, I immediately recognize the familiar "Narciso Rodriguez - For Her" presence. The scent is distinctly recognizable. Citrusy bergamot, orange blossoms, and spicy osmanthus shine here. With musk in the heart note and amber, it becomes sensually warm after a few minutes. Vetiver and vanilla form the slightly earthy base.

~ Longevity ~
On my skin, it lasts about 7 hours, which is quite long for an EDT. A modest application is necessary, as otherwise it becomes very piercing, intrusive, and synthetic, causing headaches.

~ Occasion ~
It is best suited as an evening scent on cooler autumn and winter nights. For everyday wear or in the office, it is still too strong for me.

~ Conclusion ~
I find the floral-spicy top note pleasant, but the somewhat harsh musk-vetiver combination does not appeal to me anymore.

Strangely, I actually find it really nice on other women! It just doesn’t seem to suit me...

For Her EdP seems to polarize quite a bit due to its intense musk note. I tested the EdT (thanks to Lolle), which has a significantly different composition. Musk is also present here and clearly noticeable. The musk note did not bother me, but the fragrance direction of For Her EdT (I would call it sensual-elegant-feminine) is simply not my thing.

For Her EdT starts with a sweet-floral top note and then quickly becomes amber-musk-heavy. The woody notes capture the amber-musk haze well. The scent has a very sensual quality and feels quite erotic. Nevertheless, it does not come across as vulgar or intrusive to me, but rather elegant and even a bit sophisticated. I did not experience any associations with cat pee or other organic excretions, but perhaps that depends on individual skin chemistry. I usually tolerate musk and amber well, but vanilla is often a disaster for me.

For Her EdT is a very present fragrance and extremely long-lasting. Where and when you wear it is, in my opinion, just a matter of dosage. If I liked this fragrance direction, it would definitely be a candidate for purchase for me.

Actually, I didn't plan to keep this fragrance. I bought the bottle online including a sample, so I could return it unopened if I didn't like it. The sample didn't convince me; I actually wanted to send it back, but as fate would have it (okay, now that's very dramatic :D), I printed the return form incorrectly and could only send the item back at my own expense, which wouldn't have been worth it. So I kept the bottle and thought I could either gift it or give it another chance. The scent was personally too piercing for me, a bit musty, not a nice, straightforward musk note like the other Narcisos.

Still, one morning I sprayed it on; I wanted to give it another chance before passing it on. It developed a little better; maybe my nose just needed to get used to it, I thought. Throughout the day, I forgot about it; I didn't smell it on myself anymore. But then I went shopping, and a woman at the checkout approached me. She asked what I was wearing, which I didn't understand at first. She said I smelled so good, and that was exactly what she liked.

Rattle rattle rattle. I thought about it. Oh, my perfume? What did I spray on this morning? Ahhh, the black Narciso. Really? Can you still smell it that strongly?

I must have looked a bit puzzled at first, but then I quickly pulled out my phone and showed her the perfume. Spelling out the name Narciso Rodriguez to older women who don't speak English or Spanish isn't easy; she was obviously not a Parfumo member :D But she was happy and diligently typed it out. She said she would buy it too.

After this compliment, I was quite surprised and wore it more often in the following days. The initially musty scent fades quickly, leaving a pleasant, subtle fresh fragrance with musk and flowers and a hint of woodiness, very fine in the background, perfect for everyday wear and the office. I really enjoy wearing it now and am glad I kept it!

The little black dress is indispensable in my wardrobe. It can be easily styled and fits into any life situation. Whether it's a business meeting, cocktail or party dress, or (WARNING: "black" humor) a funeral.
In short, it's an all-rounder. And why am I writing so extensively about my beloved piece of clothing? Because my Narciso for her has been empty for a few weeks now, and I only just realized that this fragrance is my all-rounder that I always reach for when I don't know what to wear…
If for her edt were a piece of clothing, it would be THE LITTLE BLACK DRESS. My safe haven. Three sprays and I'm "properly" dressed.

The scent is floral-creamy, slightly spicy - very pleasant. In a few reviews, I've read that the perfume is perceived as cool. I find the scent rather warm and cozy, somehow sensual. I can sense it on my skin for at least 8 hours - on clothing even longer.
P.S.: NR EdT has been repurchased and is now a permanent part of my wardrobe / uh, fragrance cabinet.

review_title: Black or pink... that's the question here :D
review_content:
Since I've had For Her EdT in my collection for a while now, I will write a comment. I confess to being a Narciso Rodriguez fan and will always remain one. However, I must say that I will not repurchase For Her EdT once it's empty. The only reason for this is that it does not last as long as the EdP.

The EdT starts off more orangey, then relatively quickly transitions to a scent note that I absolutely love in the EdP - and this note fades away quite quickly. What remains is a fragrance that smells good but is rather mild and unfortunately not very noticeable (not to mention that I can hardly smell it after about 1 hour).

Personally, I prefer the bottle (since I'm not really into pink) - however, everyone else thinks the EdP suits me much better, and I agree. The scent lasts a long time, and this beautiful powdery musk note is also perceived better than in the EdT. I wear the EdP really in every season, and it fits perfectly ;).

I can definitely recommend the fragrance as it smells really good - but unfortunately, it is too weak for me. When I wear For Her, I want the full, warm, powdery scent that lasts for hours.

review_title: Lady Boss or Date Night for Softer Angels
review_content:
It’s just before eight o'clock, the weekly meeting is about to begin. The employees are already seated, most of them middle-aged men in suits and ties. They are waiting for the boss. One minute before eight, you can first hear a gentle rhythm, then gradually getting a bit louder - not loud, but quite softly - click, click, click. Exactly at eight o'clock, the door opens, and she enters the room. She looks fantastic as always. Her hair, reaching to her collarbone, is tied back in a ponytail, and her black, elegant jeans make her long legs appear even longer. Her nude-colored pumps complete the look. Surrounded by a cloud of charisma, confidence, and professionalism, she walks to the head of the table and takes her seat. She places her folder on the table, sits down, crosses her legs in a ladylike manner, and greets her employees.

That same evening in a townhouse in the suburbs: she is getting ready for date night with her husband. The kids are already in bed, and the grandparents have just arrived to babysit. She wears tight jeans and a high-necked blouse. After applying a softly shimmering rose-colored gloss to her lips, she reaches for the bottle and sprays - not much, just two spritzes. She looks like an angel - gentle and lovable. However, the cloud of confidence and a certain sexiness that now envelops her changes her appearance. No one can quite put their finger on what it is. It’s as if someone has flipped a little switch; she has that special something. It’s not something that usually defines her or fits her in everyday life - but tonight, for this ONE evening, she is not just the sweet angel.

I see this fragrance on two women: on one hand, on a confident woman as the perfect signature scent, and on the other hand, on a softer, sweeter woman as an evening fragrance.

Fragrance notes (without guarantee):
Top: Bergamot
Heart: Orange Blossom, Osmanthus
Base: White Musk, Vetiver, Cedar, Amber, Vanilla, Patchouli

This scent will likely appeal to people who don't usually wear or enjoy perfume.
A clean, balanced musk fragrance. Fresh out of the shower, well-groomed, and stylishly dressed for the office.

The scent impression: Fresh, clear, subtle, elegant, well-groomed, unobtrusive, self-confident, serious, straightforward.
What the scent is not: Sensual, seductive, loud, exotic, mysterious, playful, sexy, romantic.

This scent does not clash. It is perfect for professional everyday life, leisure, or official occasions. You smell pleasantly well-groomed, but you are not trying to attract the wrong kind of attention. Sometimes you just want to smell good. Make a good impression while maintaining a certain noble distance. Perhaps even a bit aloof and not easily decipherable, yet exuding competence. For example, in a job interview.

I actually perceive the scent as unisex. I can also imagine it on men. Personally, I feel that the scent lacks the typically feminine, delicate quality that conveys comfort and intimacy. If you want something a bit more sensual and powdery, you should give the Eau de Parfum from N.R. For Her a chance. The EdP contains a bit more rose and also peach, which overall smells more like feminine skin than the Eau de Toilette being discussed here.

Blind purchase recommendation if you are looking for an all-rounder that does not clash and has that fresh out of the shower feeling to spray on.

This perfume is simply perfect. It smells high-quality, has good longevity and sillage, the notes are well balanced, and the scent impression is simply stable - there is no significant development, it just smells consistently valuable, heavy, but definitely does not come across as an old lady scent.

Personally, I can't really identify the individual notes, but the overall composition is exactly what I expect from a good perfume.

For me personally, it's not an everyday scent; it's too heavy for that. But for going out or special occasions, it is ideal.
A definite recommendation.

This is a perfect fragrance for a date.

It is sexy and seductive. I think this is because it has a sweet side but also somehow something smoky and masculine about it.
From experience, this masculinity gives just the right "kick," a certain "edginess" for a women's fragrance.

I also own the body lotion of this, which I almost prefer to use over the perfume itself, as it really lasts a long time.

A few years ago, a former colleague used "For Her (Eau de Toilette) | Narciso Rodriguez," and she scented the entire hallway with a powdery-creamy simply wonderful fragrance.

Because I liked it so much, I bought a set with the perfume and a cream.

However, my nose only detects a slightly bitter, harsh, undefinable scent, so I first gifted the cream, which smelled totally great on my colleague.
A few weeks later, I also gave away the EdP, just as bitter, harsh, and undefinable, yet it was fantastic on her.

A few years later, I tried the EdT. The bottle smelled harsh, bitter, and undefinable, and from the first spray to several hours later, there was no change on either moisturized or non-moisturized skin. I also tried layering it with "Narciso (Eau de Parfum) | Narciso Rodriguez," but unfortunately, that didn't help at all.

I love the fragrances from NR, I have "Narciso (Eau de Parfum Poudrée) | Narciso Rodriguez," "Narciso (Eau de Parfum Rouge) | Narciso Rodriguez," the Ambree (couldn't link it), "For Her Fleur Musc (Eau de Parfum) | Narciso Rodriguez," "For Her Musc Noir | Narciso Rodriguez," and a sample of "For Her Musc Noir Rose | Narciso Rodriguez," and I adore all of them, but this one just won't smell good on me :-(

With the title, I have already outed myself!
It is one of the few fragrances that I have purchased a second time (large version).
I agree with Very's comment. I don't find the honey scent intrusive or too sweet. Sprayed on in the morning, I have also had very good experiences at work. I haven't enveloped anyone, and my colleague next door has a very good nose ;-)
The heart and base notes unfold quickly. Again, I discover the woody notes as if made for me. Warm and sensual, yes, for cuddling, and that's why I occasionally spray it on my bed linens. Wonderful dreams...........

review_title: First No, then Maybe, then Definitely YES
review_content:
The more I got to smell this fragrance, the more I learned to love it. At first, I found it too sweet and somewhat scratchy in the nose on the first sniff. However, over time it became so pleasant and even addictive that I (which is extremely rare for me) bought a 100 ml bottle of it.

Now about the scent, which according to the manufacturer has only 4 notes: at the beginning, I only smell Osmathus. After less than 15 minutes, the addictive melange of amber, patchouli, and musk unfolds in combination with the somewhat fading Osmathus note. In the drydown, the fragrance becomes creamier and amber-soft, as I said, it's loveable and suitable for everyday wear despite its strength, if you only take 2 sprays ;)

and something is too much, but I can't say what. It somehow feels too strict on me, cool and aloof, slightly old-fashioned floral water. It's not an unpleasant scent in itself, but I'm missing that certain "something" that triggers something in me... after a while, I get a headache and become a coughing candidate (once again...). I had hoped that I wouldn't react to it because of the few fragrance notes, but unfortunately, I do. I wanted to like it... However, I seem not to be the only one with this feeling. Just one spray and yet it overwhelms. Not soft enough, it lacks liveliness/some kind of complexity. I see a straightforward, self-confident, distant, self-focused office worker (of course, not everyone is like that)... Sometimes the simple scents are the go-to ones, but this one just does nothing for me. The mental imagery (I am a very imaginative person) is absent. I also feel somehow not "up to it" enough for it. Which is not necessarily good or bad. Difficult :D I believe this one works super differently on everyone, it suits one person, or it doesn't (like with almost all fragrances, but with this one, it stands out to me in a particular way).

Perfume that I have been wearing for 6 years.. I have the EDT in a black bottle. I could be on my third bottle. It is very fruity, as two sprays are already sufficient. The longevity is also very nice. However, although it takes on a fresh form over time, it creates a heavy feeling in the summer months during the first moments of boredom. I can't say that it is heavy for daily wear, but it is an "ambitious" or "dominant" scent. Clear and sharp character. You know, sometimes you want to smell fresh and light, peacefully, your current combination or the environment you are going into requires this; it does not convey the feeling of freshness, cleanliness, and lightness. It dominates especially in the first squeeze. Nevertheless, it is a perfume that cannot imitate a clear scent, very sexy, and you can never say "it smells like this scent." There are rumors that the formula contains pheromones, even compared to women's sweat. I love it and connect with it and never get bored.. I want to have it forever, thank you F. Kurkdjian.
I find the beautiful bottle very nice.. Suitable for every season and for independent women. Love..

The search for perfumes is over. In an instant, my craving for new scents vanished when I finally held NR For Her in my hands. It all started in August of this year when I had the idea to get myself a NEW fragrance. There was no talk of a collection at that point, and I found it quite challenging to navigate the vast selection in drugstores. Then I stumbled upon Parfumo, and...

review_title: My Skin Chemistry - or Was the Formula Changed?
review_content: Many years ago, I attended a business English course and I still meet two of those "students" once or twice a year for dinner. I was sitting outside at the market, waiting. Petra rushed over and with her came an enchanting scent to the table, spicy, very woody, and fresh. I couldn't get enough of smelling her. "What is that?" I asked. "For her, the black one, by Rodrigues, I treated myself!" At that time, I was already looking for a new signature scent and I immediately noted this fragrance in my mind. Actually, fragrances from friends are taboo for me, but when you rarely see each other, it's okay. So the next day, I went to the city and bought this scent. My mother was still alive then and sniffed me, "hm, herb, but nice." Some time ago, I repurchased For Her, but now it doesn't smell woody and herbaceous anymore; instead, I primarily perceive sweet honey, which according to the fragrance pyramid isn't even included. I thought I might have accidentally gotten the "rosé" one, but no, it's definitely the right scent. Since then, I've been testing it again and again, but it doesn't smell the same on my skin as it used to, which is very unfortunate. At the next meeting, I will probably gift it to Petra.

I was fortunately able to get a sample. Since I had never tried a fragrance from Narciso Rodriguez before, I thought I would give it a shot, as the scent description and the comments sounded so good. And I must say, I love this fragrance! From the very first spray, I was in love :-) For me, it is a totally warm, sensual, and powdery scent. I don't pick up any honey at all; I don't find it sweet either. The amber note is very present for me, and that's exactly what I like so much. The longevity is quite good, but it could be just a tad better for me.

At first, the scent feels a bit unfamiliar to me. I can't quite say why. However, the doubts disappeared after 20 minutes and I feel very comfortable. A very balanced and elegant blend. Not too intrusive. Works for me in the colder seasons always. However, it doesn't clash either.

I really like the bottle, the minimalist design, by Narciso Rodriguez anyway.

Great fragrance, it will have a permanent place in my collection.

....often with "I didn't like you before." I'm sure some of you know that, right?

With NR Fleur Musc, it was love at first spray for me. After reading the reviews of the original here, I thought I couldn't go wrong with a blind purchase. Far from it, I hated it. It actually made me feel almost nauseous and was immediately scrubbed off my wrist.
I had read something about a "clean scent." Strange.

After I eventually tested the EdP and found it bearable, the fragrance, which had been languishing in some dark drawer, got another chance, and this time a real one.
It no longer caused nausea with a light application, but it still wasn't sparkling at the beginning.

Strangely enough, I've never been approached about a fragrance so often.
Compliments like "Mmmm, you smell so good again" and "Excuse me, may I ask what perfume you're wearing? It smells so good"
were suddenly the order of the day.
And with each wear, it grew more dear to me.

But how does it smell now?
For me, it's not sweet, not floral, not freshly showered, but warm and familiar, like me, and in an intimate way, erotic yet still suitable for daytime, as long as it's applied sparingly!

I just don't wear it while exercising; I wouldn't want to subject my "boys" to that.

In the past year, it has become one of my most frequently and dearly worn fragrances; somehow it merges with me. The EdP has also moved in with me, and both have almost replaced Fleur Musc.

review_title: Love at first sight. Love at second sniff.
review_content: Between me and Narciso Rodriguez "for her," it was not "love at first sniff." But it was "love at first sight." This black cube with clear letters, which comes without any frills, captivated me from the very beginning. For a long time, I only had a single, fresh-citrusy perfume as my signature scent and couldn't imagine that there was something better out there. Please,...

I feel like I've sniffed 99% of all designer fragrances, many of which I've worn or recommended, but I just can't warm up to this creation. To this day, it's a mystery to me why it is a signature scent for so many. So boring, unremarkable, but overall just intrusive. It does not flatter my sense of smell at all, and I wonder every time what is wrong with me?! This fragrance has managed to disappoint me anew every time; as soon as the sample is in the Douglas package, I give it a chance, and unfortunately, it always ends up in the ️, much to my annoyance. Maybe it’s all the result of an unresolved childhood trauma; psychologists among you may enlighten me. Until then, I will gladly keep my distance from this scent.

Unfortunately, it can't be done without words. But for this fragrance, you only need one thing: YES! I could write a hymn here, but that already exists. The only downside is that you won't find anything better when you feel like something new. I have reserved this scent for the most beautiful evenings and nights of the year. My everyday fragrances can't compete - but they are just everyday. For her is my dot on the i - but "chen" is too cute. My I.

So don’t get me wrong. The scent is certainly well-made, thoughtful, and many praise it to the skies; however, it is just not my cup of tea. To me, it actually smells a bit vintage, and the patchouli comes across as too blunt for my taste. I would say it is definitely not a blind buy candidate. I can understand why many like it, though. It does have something darkly seductive about it, but unfortunately, it does not seduce me.

review_title: A Daily Companion - The Unobtrusive Beauty of Narciso Rodriguez' For Her EdT
review_content:
Narciso Rodriguez' For Her EdT is a wonderful addition to any perfume collection. It is an uncomplicated fragrance that gently caresses without being intrusive. The perfume is perfect for daily wear and can be worn on any occasion - it always works.

The For Her EdT by Narciso Rodriguez has a harmonious composition of floral and musk notes that create a warm yet fresh scent.

The longevity of the perfume is satisfactory, allowing it to remain pleasantly noticeable throughout the day. The scent intensity is neither too strong nor too weak, making it a perfect companion for everyday life.

Overall, Narciso Rodriguez' For Her is an uncomplicated and unobtrusive fragrance that gently caresses and always fits. It is a timeless classic that never goes out of style.

... whether the EdT is on my right or left wrist, then I would already be a big step further, damn it. It starts off really well, as you can easily tell. And now I actually have to get up and somehow figure out which wrist I sprayed the EdT on and which one the EdP ... Very nice!

... So, now then. You really can't tell anyone what's going on with me.
So: First of all, thanks to the lovely Blanche for the sample. And beforehand: Personally, I find the difference between EdT and EdP quite small. So in that regard, I can only partially agree with Antoine. I can't deny that if you sniff a little more closely, you can definitely smell differences - especially in the softness of the scent - but if you served me the EdT and EdP side by side blindfolded, I wouldn't have the slightest clue which is which. Not a hint.

The EdT is very floral and yet has a distinctive note that I liked (and still like) right away. It smells elegant and feminine to me, and those who don't overdo it will be absolutely rewarded. I find these fragrance notes heavenly and a touch more pleasant (on me) than the EdP, which tickles my nose a bit. I don't perceive it as an everyday scent. Almost a bit too precious.

And the kicker is: I find the EdT much more present, even though it seems very delicate and creamy to me, than the EdP, which seems to be fading a bit on my other wrist.

By the way, this scent reminds me of something that I totally associate with Yves Rocher. I believe they MUST have something that smells similar. This scent feels very familiar to me, even though I have never smelled it before. But I immediately thought of Yves.

Conclusion: I want it!

review_title: Radiant Secret in the Dark Night....
review_content:
The black brother of Love in White.... A cloud of powder envelops me warmly and darkly, swirling around, the mandarin shines out, orange from the night, rising up, making me glow... Vanilla adds the cuddle factor, perfect.

I bought it on my way to a date and because I was (as usual) running late, I sprayed it on in the café... spontaneously, the ladies at the neighboring table wanted to know what I was wearing...

Well, my secret of course... my dark one :-))))))

The scent is perfect for every day and also for every season. It is a cool and pleasant fragrance that is absolutely not intrusive, but definitely noticeable. I imagine an elegant and confident woman with this scent, who knows exactly what she wants and has everything in her life under control. The perfume has great longevity and is absolutely recommended for the price.

and powdery... that's how I would describe the scent in just a few words. In fact, it struck me as slightly masculine upon my very first sniff on the test strip, but within just a few minutes, it developed into a truly unique and noble powder dream. Osmanthus and musk clearly set the tone here. However, the musk is so fine and clean, and all the fragrance notes are wonderfully connected.
Overall, this is a very mature scent. It radiates both a certain competence and a calm serenity, yet remains profound with that special something.
The longevity and sillage are in the upper range, and it is indeed one of the few fragrances for which I have received compliments so far.

The search for the perfect scent is a bit like the search for "Prince Charming." There are ups and downs, and it takes a lot of patience.
And the best love stories are known to be the complicated ones.
Between Narciso and me, it hasn't been entirely easy either.

I read about him here on parfumo, of course, and then I lingered around him for days. Every now and then, I was tempted to have a brief flirt with a test strip, but I wasn't quite sure what to make of him.
He was interesting, no question. But was he also the right one for me?
At some point, I decided that interesting is good, and I gave us a chance.
This first encounter was unfortunately a bit unfortunate, as I ended up getting quite a large amount of "For Her," and he nearly clouded my senses. I fought against his musky charm with all my might after he had previously wrapped me around his finger with honey and orange blossoms. But this boy has musk, and a lot of it, and I have my issues with musk. So I asked myself, can I be happy with him if he doesn't always do me good? In the meantime, I had even considered pairing him up with a friend or my sister just to have him nearby.

He certainly didn't leave my side all day, and the longer he stayed, the more I learned to love him. And after we spent the night together and he was still there the next morning, so soft and cuddly, I was lost.
That's when I knew: I MUST have this scent in some form. I think I'll start by trying a smaller dose. This scent certainly won't let me go that easily.

Whether we are really made for each other will still be revealed, but I will enjoy the time we have together.

Normally, my skin chemistry turns musk fragrances into a pure zoo ambiance. I smell like I've just escaped from the puma cage of a zoo (after some intense cuddling with the inhabitants).

Accordingly, I was very skeptical when I received this sample - so I carefully sprayed a tiny bit on a spot that can be easily washed off, keeping it far from my nose and waiting a bit... then cautiously bringing my nose closer to the sprayed area, gently inhaling and ... oohh, what is this? It smells really delicious!!!
For her (EdT) develops on my skin into a delicate powdery and very skin-like scent. Somehow not at all like those heavy, animalistic musk fragrances that I usually know and that do not harmonize with me at all. This musk is sweet yet fresh, subtly floral, and so wonderfully cozy in the drydown... simply delightful.

My first musk fragrance - and I am deeply in love :-)

The Narciso Rodriguez For Her Eau de Toilette is a musk fragrance in its most beautiful form. It is wonderfully soft without being intrusive; you simply smell very well-groomed and sophisticated when wearing it. I find the interplay of musk and patchouli very successful. The longevity is very good for an Eau de Toilette, about 6-8 hours, and the sillage is in the upper mid-range. All in all, a very successful fragrance.

What is that big, black block in my perfume shelf? And why did I buy such a large bottle of it back then? This beautiful fragrance had almost been forgotten. I took it out to scent the bed - for special moments. It seemed fitting for that purpose. So impenetrably black and mysterious. I liked it again from that moment on, and since winter is just the right season for this...

review_title: I almost thought this was my scent
review_content: This is yet another perfume that gave me the feeling of "oh yes, how wonderful" the first time I sprayed it and made me want to buy a large bottle right away. However, on my skin, it developed a component in the scent that made me only use it to finally finish the bottle. It’s not empty yet because I lost the spray head, and so the fragrance has been sitting around for quite a while without me missing it. I have now ordered a Travalo to get the scent out of the bottle and give it a second chance after reading the reports here and the fact that I find it really great when I smell it on other women.

This fragrance is simply sexy but not sweet-sexy, rather adult-sexy. Musk and patchouli come through quite strongly. Gradually, however, a lighter orange scent also emerges.
I can easily imagine this scent on a businesswoman who is right in the midst of life. A fragrance that gives you the aura of "here I am and I have something to say."

review_title: Wow - Love at first, second, and last sniff!!!
review_content:
This summer 2023, I trusted the countless reviews and got a sample of "For Her," mind you the Eau de Toilette.
This scent can definitely become a signature for me!

The first time I smelled it on my skin, when I received the sample, it was love at first sniff and this love has lasted until now. I believe this love will last a very long time! (right now, it’s still fresh and in love)

What does the scent smell like to me?
Like a natural woman, it could be a personal scent, like a woman who carries a wonderful, natural, sexy personal scent (without having to wear any perfume).
It also smells like intimacy, as if a couple has made love and the scent of it is still perceptible on the skin. So: Intimate, sexy, feminine, natural, addictively one after the other, because you are so in love and can’t stop touching (in this case, smelling) and yet not too intrusive, but pleasant and mild enough to wear the scent for any occasion and in any season.

My sample is running out soon and after trying some more (other) perfume samples, I realize that no other scent has come close to this one yet.
A large bottle will be purchased soon :)

Difficult scent. I have the Eau de Parfum version, which I liked very much. Then I discovered the Eau de Toilette on a friend and was thrilled - so much more adventurous, spicy, and also fresher than the original. Ordered it, sprayed it on - suddenly I wish I had the rosé version back. Tried it out. I don't like that one as much anymore either. Perfume crisis? Narciso Rodriguez For Her confuses. Definitely. Sometimes I smell sweet musk (honey fits very well there!), sometimes woody-fresh notes dominate. Then again, a sharp-spicy, animalistic "scent" emerges from the bottle. I stand by it: confusion. A pull that is already disappointing upon spraying - or not. Definitely not suitable for every day & me.

For many, this blooming abundance may be just right, but for me, it was simply too much. The intense floral notes overshadow other possible nuances of the perfume. While the musk and patchouli base does give the fragrance a certain depth, the floral impression remains very dominant.
The elegant and simple bottle contrasts with the strong scent composition. Despite the fact that the perfume is of good quality and good composition, I found the floral intensity too strong. However, for those who are looking for a very floral fragrance, this scent could be the ideal option.

It is a simple masterpiece, not because it is so complex and unique, but because it is indescribably beautiful and a lifetime favorite. Almost all Narcisos have a slightly maternal quality for me, which feels so warming and provides a sense of security. It is not unpleasant at all and lasts very long for its scent character (6-7 hours). Great signature potential and also suitable for year-round wear. The fragrance does not have a significant progression, so the top note is what you smell the whole time, the beautiful Narciso musk and a light sweet rose, even though it is not listed, blend wonderfully with the skin; it is such a "Your Skin But Better" scent.

I have never experienced a fragrance that I perceive in such different extremes.
I got to know For Her EAU DE TOILETTE and the assessment of the scent direction from "creamy" to "powdery" immediately appealed to me.
Since it was praised so highly everywhere, I went straight to my trusted perfumery and bought the fragrance (it was on sale).

Once home, I first sprayed the fragrance on paper.
The first impression: Uuuuääää what is that?
Somehow musty, piercing, scratchy, and exhausting. Could that be? Was the fragrance not right? Or was I at the beginning of a cold? I had no idea which of the notes were responsible for this, but somehow I was quite sure... we were not going to be friends at all.

Nevertheless, a few days later, I made another attempt (pretty sure I wasn't getting sick) and sprayed it on my left wrist.
(Sleeves of the blouse NOT rolled up)
But again the same impression and disappointed.

In the evening, just before the bathtub was practically calling my name and I had put my clothes in the laundry, I stood in the bathroom and noticed a very pleasant scent.
Powdery, slightly sweet, and somehow fluffy.
Then it became clear to me.
The scent that I found "piercing and disturbing" was on my clothes and "overpowered" the actual scent development.
But the heart of the fragrance and thus the "powdery-soft" facet of For Her EAU DE TOILETTE I only perceived on my skin.

There, but only on the skin, I really like the musk classic and now wear it in every season.

In hindsight, I am incredibly glad to have given For Her EAU DE TOILETTE another chance, and I advise everyone not to judge the fragrance too quickly and to try not spraying it on clothes. It apparently needs a certain warmth and time to show its true potential.

Recognition value 100% and by now a classic! One of the most beautiful women's perfumes for me.
No matter the season or time of day, this perfume simply works all the time.
This combination of orange blossom, bergamot, musk & woody notes makes it unique and sexy.
I really love sweet scents. Here there is only a delicate sweetness and yet I like the perfume immensely.
This musk scent that gives this line from Narciso Rodriguez its profile is simply the strongest here and somewhat animalistic.
Currently, I find myself reaching for classics more and more often because I like the selection.
Somehow, many perfumes hardly differentiate themselves from each other... Right now, pear, salt, tuberose, synthetic vanilla, etc. are trendy and are used everywhere.
Version 5000 of La Vie est Belle L'Eau de Parfum or Libre EAU DE PARFUM etc.
Somehow, I’m just annoyed by it all.
I want to stand out from the crowd and with this, you are exactly on the right track.

What can I possibly say about this fragrance.....
If you were to ask my 12-year-old daughter how she feels about this scent, she would smile and say "this scent? - it's my mom!"
I find it to be very warm, very cuddly - probably due to the honey and amber. It reminds me of my daughter's early childhood.... cuddling together on the couch and reading Christmas books while it's snowing outside and the candles on the Advent wreath are burning - a sense of security and safety .... that's what this fragrance conveys to me.....

I have had Narciso For Her for a few months now - honestly, I don’t even remember exactly when I bought it. It was one of those spontaneous purchases, but one of the better ones. Since then, I keep reaching for it because it simply has something special. The scent starts off powdery and clean, a bit floral, but nothing soapy or reminiscent of grandma's closet. You can smell...

First of all, the positives: longevity, sillage, and quality are really good, and the price is quite acceptable if you like the scent. However, unfortunately, I can't find much else to say positively about the fragrance. To me, it smells quite outdated and cool, like an old laundry detergent or the scent that escapes from an old wooden wardrobe filled with numerous laundry fragrance sachets or similar items when opened, combined with cold fresh winter air and a slight chemical dentist note. Additionally, it has an indefinable musty, almost stinky note that becomes somewhat strange to me after a while. Unfortunately, this is absolutely not my fragrance.

review_title: Lily of the Valley Shower in January
review_content: I have tested the scent in pink and black from the shelf every now and then and found both to be subtle, pleasant companions. Then I must have caught it one time too many at Duty Free: the purest lily of the valley shower for several hours on my right arm! I couldn't believe it! Could this be?! I read the comments and found a note from Morticia among others. Was this an...

review_title: I really want to like it so much
review_content: What is wrong with me? I love all Narcisos that I know without exception, but this one, which probably everyone knows, just doesn't manage to convince me. A few years ago, when I first owned a bottle of this fragrance, I used it a lot at first. At some point, I didn't like it anymore and gave the rest away. Then I kept hearing great reviews and after a few years, I wanted to give it another chance and bought it again. It has to appeal to me; I love the typical Narciso DNA?! In short: I hardly reach for this fragrance; unfortunately, it doesn't compare to Pure Musc or Musc Noir Rose for me. It's not bad, don't get me wrong, but somehow we just don't connect properly.

I’ll say it upfront, I love this scent; unfortunately, it doesn’t last long on the skin, but on clothing, it can still be smelled days later. It’s such a true feel-good fragrance, like just having showered... Musk and patchouli gently settle on the skin, leaving such a pleasant wearing experience. Floral and powdery yet still so fresh.

The bottle is also beautiful, and the spray nozzle is great.
Clear recommendation to buy.

Is considered an outstanding fragrance because of its unique and captivating scent. The fragrance features notes of musk, floral and woody accords, resulting in a warm, sensual and sophisticated aroma. The perfume is also highly acclaimed for its long-lasting scent and its ability to complement the wearer's natural scent. Additionally, the fragrance has received numerous positive reviews and awards, further establishing its status as a standout perfume. Narciso Rodriguez's expert blend of different scents creates a unique and memorable fragrance that stands out in a crowded market, making it an exceptional choice for those seeking a luxurious and alluring scent.

In the first few minutes, it comes across as somewhat sharp to me. The musk comes through, along with the patchouli. Wonderfully noble and balanced. Amber in the base makes it soft and sensual. A dreamily beautiful bottle that perfectly reflects the character of the fragrance, in my opinion. Great longevity. Suitable for almost any occasion. Absolutely comforting. A little mysterious at the same time. love it.

At first, I didn't like the scent. It wasn't exciting enough for me. At some point, suddenly, I fell in love with it at second glance, and since then it has been my go-to fragrance. I love this rounded composition. The musk is so beautifully creamy, and although I don't like patchouli, it doesn't bother me in this scent at all. It's also exciting that this fragrance is not a typical jasmine-orange blossom-musk scent, but unique.
Furthermore, I must mention that I receive countless compliments for this fragrance. Not just a "you smell good," but a "who smells so good here, what is that?, your perfume smells sooo good." The price-performance ratio is unbeatable. The bottle is elegant and timelessly beautiful. The sillage and longevity are good. In conclusion, a clear recommendation for everyone who wants to smell classic, elegant, and a little sexy.

Soft, pillowy musk tones down sharp but powdery Papyrus (almost rice-like in scent and texture). Heavenly Blue Lotus in it's beautiful floralcy flirts with you. Cinnamoned Orris and hints of red wine seduce you. A lightly leathered smoky incense tugs at the edges of this.

Hey, who are you to snuggle up to me so cheekily and closely? Possessively wrapping your 8 arms around me while smiling sweetly...! It gives me goosebumps and I don't know if it's out of fear or joyful excitement. It's outrageous and bold to be so captivating. You want to push it away and pull it closer. It's just mean and I hate this confusion. Yes, No, Yes, No... Maybe? Ugh... wicked!
*
But what is it that makes me think so much about Eye Hatshepsut?
Well, it's simple. At first, this scent starts almost pure, powdery, dry, and cool smoky. Then it transforms a bit into something softer through the iris butter, tasty, fatty, but not intrusive. Kajal accord - does it refer to the color or the smell? It could be this dry, slightly earthy quality. A splash of wine, reddish, bright, and dry again. A very minimal fruitiness, unsweetened.
And then cinnamon - oh how I love you... becoming dusty sweet, without softening the coolness of the scent. The smokiness transforms into incense, mmmmh, not cold church incense, but a fine, aromatic incense that paired with the honey-scented labdanum becomes beautifully smooth. It doesn't stand out harshly at all, but flows along with the fragrance notes. Musk is not a dominant note, but it's present. It's terribly exciting, forever this slightly dark, gloomy, and then again the bright, soft. There is never a single direction, and that's really beautiful. It's an unusual scent that I can well imagine on a dark-haired, voluptuous woman who doesn't always reveal everything about herself - so I *g* ;-)
A fragrance that both genders can wear. On a man, it will certainly be a bit more rugged.
I want it because it's so outrageously captivating.
30ml however 100$

No woody notes, or green. No "white flowers", just a soft gardenia and a tuned down grapefruit note.

It is pleasant, but I most definitely get better results in both longevity and sillage from the Absolu. I would have to layer them both to get the perfect balance, and at the price tag the pure parfum goes it's a big disappointment. I was expecting way more projection, intensity in the accords, but they are subdued and too timid.

Personally, a pure parfum so weak it's not worthy the price. But as it goes, I have them both now and will layer pure over absolu.
It's a 5 out of 10 from me: keep your money and buy more absolu if you enjoy the woody grapefruit with faint flowery vibes. I honestly cannot believe how weak this extract is.

Btw... interestingly, Jour pure works wonderfully with Bottega Veneta (the orginal). Try to believe! :-)

I recently reviewed Al Haramain's Amber Oud Tobacco. This 'Rouge' release couldn't be more different in terms of performance...

The tobacco last for days, the rouge (Batch Code: 140120011037) last for literally minutes...
There is almost no sillage right from the start - after 15 min I doubt that anyone will notice you are wearing this..
I can still smell this very faintly after an hour if press my nose right on the place where I sprayed...
I tried overspaying - not much effect

It's a real pity as this is a nice fragrance but completely unusable for me as a fragrance... I'd be respraying all the time.

Given the many people who report good performance all I can think is poor quality control in their manufacturing process...

The presentation is very impressive like for the tobacco - fancy hinged box and nice bottle. With all that effort it's a shame that the fragrance doesn't live up to expectations. This not a release that Al Haramain can be proud of.

BTW, I didn't find this for sale on the Al Haramain website - maybe the company gave up on this too.
Their Amber Oud Tobacco is really good.

Basically, I agree with my predecessor's review; the scent smells almost exactly like its predecessor, but a bit darker/less sweet and thus - if you will - "more masculine." Therefore, it is accurate to describe it as the brother of BR540 (as a sister). The fact that the scent performs a bit weaker might not be so bad, considering how often and intensely one encounters BR in everyday life. I find it very pleasant.
All in all, the scent is worth it, although it has also become relatively expensive, and cheaper alternatives are available (e.g. Baroque Rouge 540 for about 30 euros).

Amber Oud Rouge has similar components to its predecessor, especially the saffron note is noticeable. I also own BR 540 and must say that the two are particularly similar in the dry down, but in terms of sillage and performance, Amber Oud Rouge unfortunately cannot keep up, in my opinion. BR is much more striking and fills every room with a cloud of fragrance, its little brother is not as prominent. However, I must mention that Amber Oud Rouge is truly the closest of all the dupes I have tested so far to BR. At first, Amber Oud Rouge was very affordable, making the price-performance ratio a 10/10, but since the fragrance apparently is no longer being produced, the prices have become significantly more expensive and at around €80 now, it is no longer worth it.

I tested this fragrance directly on my skin in a store without any knowledge of the fragrance pyramid. At first, a very sweet, berry-fruity scent wafted towards me - too sweet for my taste. After about half an hour, however, the sweetness diminished and a very pleasant creaminess emerged, making me want to sniff my wrist repeatedly. In the drydown, I then noticed a slightly sweet, creamy leather note that lingered for hours.
I think it's worth a try for all fans of sweet fragrances to test Authentic Moment; the price-performance ratio is definitely right.

Andalusi is a stunning leathery rose.

There's rose and leather of course, being the main components of the scent from the beginning to the end. The leather is dry and well rounded with the perfect amount of fizz and strength, meanwhile the rose is delicate, yummy and airy.

Apple and saffron are super prominent the first hour along with a soft oud. The oud is little funky, but nothing fecal or animalic just in case. It's supporting the leathery facet of the main accord and is present for a short period of time.

When the things calm down, a red sweet note takes preponderance (maybe ethyl maltol?) and the musk arise too. There's some vanilla and amber undertones that give depth and warmth.
Although there is an obvious sweetness in this fragrance is not a sweet fragrance per se. I think it's very well balanced.

The blending and the quality of the ingredients are top notch. This fragrance moves through its life showing a considerable amount of complexity.

Performance is excellent on my skin. It projects very well for 2 or 3 hours and lasts forever. I can smell it even the next day.

Presentation is just out of this world. One of the best presentation I've ever seen. The bottle and the box are so unique and luxurious.

In Andalusi, Arabian Oud has managed to remove some of the aspects of Layton and Layton Exclusif that I didn't enjoy, whilst adding a couple of oriental notes and boosting the performance. It is as if they took the Layton line as a blueprint and then sought to improve upon it.

As an illustration, saffron has been added to the top notes and it blends beautifully with the apple and bergamot. It is an intriguing accord which improves upon the opening of the original Layton.

In the mid dry down rose and very subtle non-cloying vanilla come to the fray. The dank note (civet?) that you get from Layton Exclusif is thankfully absent here. Here, the mid is an improvement on Layton Exclusif.

The base is very similar to Layton Exclusif with oud, amber, and sandalwood. However, instead of coffee and patchouli we have clean leather. Again, an improvement in my view. That dank dirtiness is gone.

So, here we have a Layton top with the addition of saffron, and a Layton Exclusif heart and base with the removal of dank and dirty accords and the addition of leather. It's an example of East meets West done well.

If you are a fan of Layton or Layton Exclusif, or found those two fragrances lacking in performance, or even put off by the dank accords, give Andalusi a try.

This is my first Tauer fragrance and I must say, I am not disappointed whatsoever. Nexin will take you on a journey of smelling wild flowers in its natural habitat.

Initial spray, you’ll be greeted by the florals. Easily the orange blossom and cold geranium are noticeable. Also, there is a note I’m not familiar with that smells divine. Maybe lemon blossom or orris root? I’m not sure, but it marrys well with the other notes.

While the top notes are dazzling your olfactive senses, the earthiness from the vetiver, ambergris and oakmoss are running parallel from the start also. Kinda reminds me of a freshly watered flowerbed with damp soil. This is my favorite part because I love vetiver and oakmoss.

Nexin is unisex in the opening and leans masculine in the dry down, but I can see everyone enjoying this.

Sillage and projection are good.

If this wasn’t a limited run, I think many would enjoy wearing this in the spring, summer and autumn.

Why did Andy Tauer decide to call this perfume NEXIN? He says it captures the essence of our connection with the cosmos and the stars. When you google what nexin means you will find out it is a proteinous inter-doublet linkage.... gets a bit more complicated but the linkage is the key word here.
My personal scent story with NEXIN is not under dark sky full of stars. I see it linked to morning sky.
I imagine myself inside a cottage, remote, on a hill. It is spring time. Early morning. I am in the kitchen baking a lemon cake and the smell of lemon zest is everywhere. On my windowsill I grow pelargoniums, the kind that have leaves smelling of lemon and rose. I look outside onto the garden and see a gentle breeze touching the white linen drying. Sky is pale blue and so is the sun. It is peaceful.
I see NEXIN linked to pale blue, pale yellow and white.
I see it linked to cripsy washed white shirts in L'EAU, orange detergents in Orange star and Alpine air in L'Air Des Alpes Suisses.
If you like above three, you will enjoy it.

“And I like listening to the stars at night… they're like five hundred million rattles.”
Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Admiring the night, which unites all things, which causes its dark blanket and silence to descend: who has never enjoyed this sensation, admiring the magnificence of that moment?
Nexin takes its name from the Latin "nexus", which means connection: the connection of all the elements but also, in the olfactory world, of the fragrances of Andy Tauer, who here too manages to give us a true olfactory masterpiece.
An alchemy of notes that delights us with dusty and vintage accents refreshed by a whiff of citrus and warmed by woods.
Absolutely worth smelling, it cannot fail to be appreciated by lovers of niche fragrances.
Warm and enveloping, like a beautiful and immense summer night.
“Starry Night” painted by Potthast.

Unisex fragrances usually don’t strike too close to ‘a good fit’ for me. Usually they sit in a category of ‘Good but would I actually wear this?’

Most of the time it’s no, there’s a list of fragrances that I rate highly but just don’t couldn’t wear. The list of unisex fragrances that I would wear is short. This is not due to any prejudice against unisex fragrances moreover I have found them to veer towards sweet. I am inclined to think that this is intentional by the brand/perfumer

What Andy Tauer has created here is exactly the kind of fragrance that is truly ‘unisex’. It satisfies that particular narrow criteria that I have placed upon these type of fragrances. There’s no lean towards masculine or feminine but it remains squarely in the centre.

The issue though is that though this has so many notes that I like and would ordinarily go for, it’s not a fragrance I would see myself buying a full bottle of; I would happily wear this had I had a decant of or if I was gifted this - though I couldn't push myself to buy this. I don't understand this stumbling block (oddly I know this is limited and my chances of buying this are small). Though this goes back to what I was saying earlier, this sits in that list of unisex fragrances that I like; but I don't usually want those fragrances. I am unsure how to say that I like this but I don't want it.

review_title: How is Opus-Arte from Swan Lake by P.I. Tchaikovsky connected to the new perfume Nexin by A. Tauer?
review_content: A fragile, breezy cool to metallic cold citrus scent with iris roots in moss, with slightly spicy woods from No. 12 and aldehydes from the aromatic pentachord trio (Auburn, Verdant, White) on a musk-aldehyde cloud. The perfume, released in honor of the brand's 18th anniversary, has the final digit 9 (1+8), with the number 9 completing the 9-year life cycle in a numerological sense. My bottle bears the number 163, which signifies 1 (1+6+3=10; 1+0=1 and the one is further enhanced by zero). Nexin can be seen as the end or even the beginning of something new in Andy's work. Let's see which direction he will take. And how does Nexin smell? As is Andy's habit when it comes to something significant. Nexin is something special - a delicate, strict, metallic cold, floral and distinctive scent all in one. What I appreciate about it is the uniqueness to neutrality and the detachment from the distinctly sweet or distinctly fruity, earthy and airy creations of the two nine-year-old predecessor lines. Upon seeing the white bottle, the Opus Arte music from P.I. Tchaikovsky's ballet Swan Lake comes to mind. With each sniff, I associate this beautiful piece of music with Andy.

review_title: You think you have a simple floral water in front of you, and then...
review_content:
The notes of the fragrance sounded very pleasant from the start - as a confessed fan of tea and floral notes, I felt immediately drawn in. Then I saw the price... uff. Does it have to be?
In the past, I have often tested expensive fragrances that were absolutely not worth the price. It was then easy to shake my head and let the samples go. I was fortunate enough to receive a sample of this fragrance, which was somewhat cheaper, but still quite pricey for a sample. Somehow, I still felt that it had to be.
The fragrance captivated me from the very first second. Yes, it is a floral tea scent. But it brings a deep, pleasant spiciness that elevates it from mediocrity. It remains ever-present, bringing both freshness and a certain warmth, making it no trivial floral water. The sillage is subtle, which I really like - the more familiar I become with perfumes and the older I get, the less I want to bother people with a cloud of scent. Rather, I wish for a fragrance that is always present but underscores my personality and not the other way around, true to the motto: I want to wear the fragrance, not the fragrance wear me.
For a fragrance with such a fresh, light-footed character, I find the longevity (about 9 hours for me, during which I perceive it constantly) perfectly acceptable.
